I am an old player coming back to the world of yugioh and am collecting again. I haven't played since shaddolls, qliphorts and tellas were meta. I used to play a really fun deck that is known to be a great deck built right. Chaos Dragons has always been my favorite deck since I started playing when Dragon's Collide structure deck came out. I've been looking around for some viable options of builds for Chaos Dragons but haven't really found anything that has interested me until now.  I found this awesome video that I was very happy to see someone putting together a newer, more modern version of Chaos Dragons called Chaos Dragon Lightsworns. I've done it up a bit and have summitted an example of what I could play and played around with some good cards that could go well with deck.  Let me know if ya'll have any suggestions of how I could make it a little better. I really want to help revive Chaos Dragons.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a7Ka5wCclFI

deck_excerpt: Two of my favorite Fusion Decks of all time, merged into one.
deck_description:
Hi, Grayewick the Fusionist here, and I can finally post a deck list that I’ve worked on since the day they got released, presenting Despia Dogmatika Shaddolls. First of all, I wanna preface this list first by saying that at the time of posting this list, Master Duel still hasn’t addressed the crucial parts of the meta game, including the banning of necessary cards that have been plaguing the format and unlimiting the cards that were either limited or semi-limited that are not even meta threats to begin with, so just keep that in mind when looking through the card ratios. Anyway, the list. “Why play this deck?” Well… if it still wasn’t obvious enough in most of the lists that I’ve posted, I love Fusion Summoning, and this deck features two decks that do both, being Despia and Shaddolls, and Dogmatika is always a great engine to be splashed with any Fusion strategy that needs LIGHT targets such as the two previously mentioned and of course, Invoked, but unlike the latter, this actually has a better draw power and can play a lot better around and through Ash Blossom. I’ll discuss the other intricacies further in the list. The Main Deck: • The Despia (Aluber, Dramaturge, & Tragedy) – Your substitute to the Invoked engine. Does it play around Ash? Yes, and arguably better than Invoked. Is it better? Debatable. Here are their effects.
  1. Aluber – The successor to the best Normal Summon in the game, Aleister the Invoker. Allows you to search any “Branded” Spell/Trap from your Deck, much like his aforementioned precursor, and has a semi-relevant effect that Special Summons himself from the GY when a face-up Fusion Monster you control is either destroyed by battle or was removed from the field by an opponent’s card effect, to target and negate the effects of an opponent’s monster until the end of the turn. Not the best negation effect, but it’s better than nothing.
  2. Dramaturge – The semi-brick of the deck, since you don’t really mind drawing him though you’d still much rather search for him. Has an effect that Special Summons himself from the GY or when banished after getting used as Fusion Material while he’s in either your hand or field. Also has an effect that negates the effects of any targeted monster when a Fusion, Synchro, Xyz, or Link monster is Special Summoned, which comes up occasionally.
  3. Tragedy – Your main searcher. Mandatory 3 of in any list that runs Despia cards, don’t believe anyone who tells you otherwise. There’s literally no reason not to run 3 of these. Upon getting sent to the GY or banished by a card effect, it searches you any “Despia” monster, which makes your Allure of Darkness essentially a +1 in card advantage. It also allows you to recycle your “Branded” Spells/Traps from your GY by banishing itself, although you can only use either one or its other effect once per turn.
• The Dogmatika (Ecclesia, Fleurdelis, & Maximus) – Standard monster ratios for the Dogmatika engine. We’d have to run 3 Ecclesias since she also acts as a LIGHT Attribute Fusion Material, and because Nadir Servant is still at 1 for some reason. Just hover over their names to see their effects. • The Shaddolls (Beast, Dragon, Genius, Ariel, Hedgehog, & Falco) - Much like the Invoked variant, you only really want to run 1 of each of these, but run just enough so that you still have a pretty decent chance of drawing one of them if you need them. They all have pretty simple effects, so just hover over their names to see what they do. Hand traps could literally be anything. Ash is just generally good, Veiler is also great for being a LIGHT target so is either Nibiru or Lancea (which is also great for being a Fairy). It's really up to you. The Spells • Allure of Darkness - Your main draw power. As I have stated before, is a +1 when combined with Despian Tragedy. • Nadir Servant - A lone copy of this is still worth playing, since we're still playing Psy-Framelord Omega. • Shaddoll Fusion - One of the most revolutionary Fusion Spells in the game. A generally good splashable Fusion spell that people love crying about since it uses Fusion Materials from the Deck. • Foolish Burial - Utility 1 of and GY setup. Also instantly triggers the effects of all your Shaddoll monsters and Despian Tragedy. • El Shaddoll Fusion - Makes pushing for game easier, dodges both Ash and Droll during the Draw Phase. • Called by the Grave - Hand trap protection. • Branded Opening - Your main searcher spell, and primary way of summoning Aluber. It discards as a part of its effect, so it also triggers your Shaddoll monsters, allowing you to chain block the Aluber you've summoned. Also provides your Fusion monsters a protection from destruction effects as a substitute by banishing itself from the GY. • Super Polymerization - Great removal spell, great combat trick, easily abusable by this deck due to it only caring about two attributes, which so happen to also be the most popular and ubiquitous ones in the game being LIGHT and DARK, only at a cost of discarding. This card has no reason to be at 2, but it's better than being at 1 or nothing. • Despia, Theater of the Branded - Your main search target for Aluber. It's a Field Spell that's also a Fusion Spell. It also allows you to Special Summon any Level 8 or higher Fusion Monster from your GY when a non-Fusion Fairy monster is destroyed by battle or was removed from the field by an opponent's card effect. The (only two) Traps • Resh Shaddoll Incarnation - One of your revival spells. Allows you to negate multiple times with Apkallone, to revive Winda from the GY after getting outed, or to help you with the grind game by looping your Ariel and Falco. If you want added security for the grind, I suggest adding Hound to loop this easier. • Shaddoll Schism - The bane of every Special Summon that starts a chain, for its most popular application of allowing you to summon Winda during your opponent's turn, but is also a non-targeting, non-destruction removal, provided that you're summoning a "Shaddoll" Fusion Monster that shares an attribute with an opponent's monster. The Extra Deck: Note: I've made this semi-budget, because I'm still saving gems for the Darklord cards and more staples necessary for that build which I may or may not be sharing soon. I'll see. • The First Darklord - A non-Despia Fusion Monster that is actually one of your best boss monsters. Provides all your Fairy monsters protection from targeting, which includes El Shaddoll Construct. Also allows you to Special Summon a Fairy monster from either your hand or GY during the Main Phase at a cost of 1000 LP, which includes El Shaddoll Construct. • The Despian Fusions (Proskenion & Quaeritis) - Proskenion is a Despia Fusion Monster that requires 3 Fusion Materials, including a LIGHT, a DARK, and a "Despia" monster. Allows you to either banish or steal an opponent's Fusion, Synchro, Xyz, or Link monster from their GY (and it does not negate their effects). It also burns your opponent equal to a monster's original ATK or DEF when it destroys it by battle (whichever was higher). Quaeritis on the other hand only requires a "Despia" monster and either a LIGHT or a DARK monster. It also has an effect that allows you to modulate the ATK values of all monsters currently on the field to 0, except for Level 8 or higher Fusion monsters, which essentially makes your opponent's Apollousa useless. • The Shaddoll Fusions (Construct, Apkallone, & Winda) - Construct, the once banned darling of Shaddolls, notorious for resource looping due to its non-once per turn effects and for its non-targeting combat removal. Apkallone, the newest addition to the family and is a very much welcome one, offers you a PERMANENT targeting negation, which not a lot of players are aware of, and an effect that lets you loop "Shaddoll" cards in your GY or search them from the Deck. Winda, the most infamous of all of them, she's the resident floodgate that a lot of players love crying about. Two of her is the minimum, even as just a splash for the Dogmatika engine. • The Super Poly targets (Starving Venom Fusion Dragon & Mudragon of the Swamp) - Two of the best generic Super Poly targets, one being against the most common Attribute in the game, which is DARK, and the other for the weirder ones, mainly WIND, especially now that Baronne De Fleur is already in the game. • Psy-Framelord Omega - Essential for murdering your opponent's Extra Deck with the Dogmatika engine. • Condemned Darklord - A generic Link 2 for your Fairies. You could play Predaplant Verte Anaconda instead, it's fine. • Gravity Controller - A way to out problematic monsters in the EMZ. Also a DARK target for Winda, and is a part of the Construct resource loop. Final Thoughts Despia is just one of those decks that were initially weak on release, and was even ridiculed by some players for how "underwhelming" they were, compared to Swordsoul and Flundereeze at that time, until recently that they've received a wave of fantastic support, including an archetypal Shaddoll Fusion. I for one am happy about it, but of course, I know that a lot of people weren't, especially in a format where Verte Anaconda is legal, which gave them trauma from Fusion Spells that use materials from the deck, which is arguably the least of their problems, in a format where Artifact Scythe is legal. Regardless, expect this archetype to only get better over time, and don't listen to people who only trash archetypes because of how bad they were at first, especially if it's a Fusion strategy. There's really not much else to say about this deck that I haven't said already, instead as per usual, if you have any questions or thoughts, feel free to express them down in the comments and I'll respond to them as soon as I possibly can.

deck_excerpt: Same Old Sprigans Xyz Spam with the new Springans Kitt.
deck_description: Same Old Sprigans Xyz Spam with the new Springans Kitt. The combos are pretty much the same: You activate "Great Sand Sea - Gold Golgonda", discard 1 Springans monster, summon "Springans Merrymaker", then, based on what you discarded and/or what you milled with Merrymaker, you can choose what to do.  The problem with the old version of the deck was the Great Sand Sea, because, without it in your starting hand or a way to search it, it was a 100% brick, but, thanks to "Springans Kitt" and "Branded in High Spirit", you can do an xyz summon with just one card. The only problem with this new deck are the handtraps. Cards like Ash Blossom, Artifact Lancea, Ghost Belle, Etc... literally kill this deck, so, cards like Called by the grave and Crossout can literally save your games.  This is just a for fun deck, and pretty budget too (Expect for F0 Utopic Draco that you can change with a lot of rank 4/8 xyz monsters), so, if you are a new player and/or you like Xyz monster, this deck is, in my opinion, perfect. Have fun guys!

deck_excerpt: Combo version of Herald of Perfection Deck. We use the Halqifibrax Auroradon combo for 2 extended combos and 1 base combo to put multiple negates on
deck_description: In the current meta, add 3 Diviner of the Herald with 1 copy of Trias Hierarchia in place of the Cyberse package. The combo for the Diviner package: summon Diviner of the Herald and activate its effect to send Trias Hierarchia to the graveyard. Avtivate Trias Hierarchia's effect to summon itself from the graveyard by tributing Diviner of the Herald. Now, activate Diviner of the Herald's effect to special summon 1 Level 2 or lower Fairy monster from your hand or Deck. Summon Crystron Halqifibrax and go on from there.  This deck uses 2 extended combos, so choose which one you want to run. That's in Duel 1 & 2. The cards for the 2nd extended combo are in the Side Deck. The base combo with one Deskbot 001 is in Duel 3. This deck is mainly a going 1st deck. We use Archlord Kristya in this build to lock Special Summoning. There are cases you might end up with more than 4 fairies in grave because you used one of the Heralds in hand effects. Pot Of Avarice could help with that at the end of the combo if you have it in hand. Other than that, they are extra fodder for Herald of Perfection. Sauravis, the Ancient and Ascended is to protect you from hand traps.  https://youtu.be/CDiwDYEzLh4

deck_excerpt: Have fun removing your opponents annoying monsters and bringing monsters with funny effects and high attack.
deck_description: Main points of the deck, 1)Remove annoying monsters by using them as tributes for your kaiju monsters and your lava golems(less triggers)  2)Take control of the kaiju monsters that where summoned on your opponents side and your opponents monsters in general using the graydle monsters(their effect activates in the gy even during the bp) or using the mimicking man-eater bug to destroy a monster and get your bug gain its attack and be indestructible by monsters effects of monsters with the same type(also indestructible by battle).  3)Get your opponents field full of unusable cards using the floodgates, quaking mirror force, swords of concealing light  4)Prevent your opponent monsters from attacking using the prediction princess petalelf  5)Bring powerful monsters to destroy your opponent while getting his monsters to sleep.  Backrow removal: superquantal mech beast grampulse(lev 3 xyz), tornado dragon(lev 4 xyz)  Get cards go places: shining piecephillia, daigusto emeral  beaters: number 30(lev 3 xyz), kaijus, number s39 by xyz summoning it with utopia and removing 2 materials, dark rebellion xyz dragon  direct attack: number 47  number 41: while on defense change every monster summoned to defense and negate their effects  getting your opponents lp down by their own beaters: chronomaly chrystal chrononaut.     You could add number 27 to special summon a level 10 or higher xyz machine monster after this monster destroyed a monster during the endphase.  I have other interesting cards in the side deck if you want to make changes in the extra deck. I made this deck today and it's still kind of new but it's very fun to play with. Let me know what you think and have fun.
Thanks to the new Structure Deck (Albaz Strike), some cards, like Pot of Extravagance or Dark Ruler No More, this deck is much more budget, and can be played for only 50$ more or less.

Hmm...new card, new deck

the gameplan:  You should have 1 Frightfur Fusion in hand, either Polymerization or Fluffal Owl, 1 Edge Imp Sabres and 1 Fluffal monster, and another Fluffal monster that is either in your hand or in your GY.  Use Poly or Fluffal Owl to fusion summon Frightfur Tiger, using your Edge Imp and at least 1 Fluffal. Use it's ability to clear your opponent's monsters and anything else that would stop it from attacking directly.  Use Frightfur Fusion to summon Frightfur Wolf using Edge Imp Sabres and 2 Fluffals as material. Wolf can attack 3 times, and gets a boost thanks to Tiger. Attack for game with both Frightfurs.  Fluffal Dog is in the deck to search Owl and Keeper of Dragon Magic gets you Poly. A bunch of negates stops your opponent from getting their ideal end board and of course the other fluffals are for fusion material.  Have fun!

deck_excerpt: Albaz Despia Deck Master Duel - This deck is for Master Duel specifically as alot of the despian cards are not in the game.
deck_description: Good Afternoon Everyone, Today we got A spicy number. We are playing Despia with a small splash of Aleister because we didn't get all the Despia cards we wanted from this patch sadly. But we got our main boys and Fallen of Albaz which is insane. This deck is running 5 super polys essentially, fallen of albaz's effect is like super poly minus the "Neither Player Can activate cards or effects in response." it's still insane. First of all this is a turn 2 deck, if we go turn one we hope to open invoker as we really don't have many turn 1 strats besides opening the field with a super poly face down and invoked mechaba to protect the backrow. This deck has 1 shot capabilities with Dramaturge of Despia being able to come back after being used as materials with a whooping 3k attack but overall the reason I love this deck is how versatile it is with all our swiss army knife options in the Extra Deck. Since Master Duel is a best of one format having a plethora of extra deck options for every occasion helps in alot of ways. We run Artemis for Aleistar as we do not have many light monsters in the deck so this gives us a cheap easy way to get into Invoked Mechaba. Main boss monsters you want to get into are Despian Quaeritis and Despian Proskenion as they are very annoying to deal with for the Opponent. This deck still could use some ironing out as there are alot of cards I want to test this deck out with but Honestly it's been doing really well against meta decks so I wanted to share it.

the gameplan:  1: set Chain Material  2: Next turn play fusion gate and activate chain material  3: Use both your card's effects to banish Burstinatrix, Avian, Bubbleman and Clayman as material to summon Electrum. Electrum will shuffle your heros back into the deck, recycling them.  4: Summon a second Electrum the same way  5: overlay into Gustav Max and deal 2000 damage with it, detaching an Electrum  6: Use the Electrum in the grave and the Gustav on field to fusion summon gaia  7: Use the second Electrum (in the grave now because you banished Gustav) and Gaia to Summon The Shining.  8: Fusion summon the third Electrum to recycle your banished cards  9: Repeat steps 4-8 until you win.  I put Lilith in the deck to search Chain Material and Demise of the land and terraforming for fusion gate. There are also many hand traps.  This OTK is awesome. have fun!

deck_excerpt: My best attempt at combining combining the Adventure engine with with the Branded and Despia cards.
deck_description: The main strategy is protecting your Branded Fusion to facilitate a Dragoon or Mirrorjade play with an Adventure engine negate, while being flexible enough to transition into normal Despia plays if/when interrupted. Failing that, setting up a Guardian Chimera play with Branded in Red during your opponent's turn is a good fallback strategy as well. Remember that Ad Libitum can bring back any of your Despia or lvl 8 or higher fusion monster from the grave or banished in a pinch, so don't be afraid to use some of your boss monsters as fusion material in those situations.  Something else to stay aware of is the negation effect of Dragostapelia, making affected monsters lvl 1. This can be important for the Quick Effect of Quaeritis. Summoning Masquerade for decks that need to activate a lot of effects to set upa board can be and be a recipe for an easy win, especially for decks using the same Adventure engine. Like with any other deck, thinking through your plays beforehand and staying aware of as much as possible (field, GY, banished, deck, once-per-turns, etc.) for both you and your opponent is paramount to success. Keeping plays simple and making optimal choices will see you through to the end. Have fun and enjoy.

deck_excerpt: Uses Ravenous to boost ATK of all monsters
deck_description:
This deck can easily bring out Ravenous Tarantula, which allows you to increase your monster's ATK by the difference between LP. This is especially powerful considering the train archetype is able to do lots of damage quickly. Some basic combos are:
  1. preset metal reflect slime
  2. activate revolving switchyard
  3. summon knight express night / chain heavy freight train derricrane
  4. revolving switchyard activates, summoning Flying Pegasus as a lvl 10.
  5. activate metal reflect slime, putting 4 lvl 10s on the field
  6. (optional but helpful) activate Mound of the Bound Creator, preventing your opponent from destroying monsters, + makes it harder to negate.
  7. Summon Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Gustav Max, to burn 2000, then go into Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Juggernaut Liebe to get a 6000 ATK onto the field
  8. xyz summon Ravenous Tarantula from the remaining two monsters to increase liebe to 8000 ATK
Strategy coming soon

deck_name: Cyber Dragon Branded New META Very EASY COMBOS GUIDE
deck_description: https://youtu.be/Jo-xg_v80pw
For Master duel

My deck that I topped 8 somewhat small WCQ. 7 rounds My strategy is simple win my 1st game and try to cheese my 2nd game if not 3rd game more siding. Winning 1st game is easy because nobody mains back row removal. 2nd game the opponent will ether choose to go 1st or 2nd, a lot of mind game at the tourney. During the 2nd game if won 1st game I side in 3x waking the dragon and/or 3x sphere mode if playing against combo decks, this way I’m prepared to go 1st or 2nd. If they make me go 1st and I open with trap trix or waking the dragon I only set 2-3 this way I still have floodgates set and in hand just in case if they do have that lightning storm or whichever back row removal while still having cards in my hand for next turn as well. 3rd game usually will have lost 2nd game, side in everything besides sphere mode. I use dark bribe because at 3rd round solemn judgment takes too much lp and I’ll lose to time.  Played 4 floowdereeze 3 of the 4 I won using ultimate falcon because they have zero ways out.

The core strategy is to get your millennium-eyes restrict out as fast as possible, with as many absorbs as possible while being able to recycle itself. Short and simple: The Restrict Deck core (1st Engine)
  • Golden-eyes = if sent to the graveyard or banished gives a relinquished/restrict monster an extra SUCC as if it was from its own effect. And if you can summon it, use its effect to look at your opponent's hand then either fusion it away or link up to anima/link 2 monster such as anaconda if you have another monster on the field.
  • Millennium-eyes Illusionist = (quick effect) discard to SUCC as if by their own effect. and if a relinquished/restrict is special summoned, re-add it back into your hand so good to use as ritual material
  • Relinquished Fusion = you can banish it for the 4th and final potential SUCC as if it was by your monsters' effect.
  • Illusionist Faceless Magician = when relinquish is destroyed by battle or card effect, special summon a previous summoned relinquished/restrict, and if they are destroyed bring this one back from the grave (each once per turn).   ***A potential tech is to use it as ritual material and have a torrential tribute ready in case your opponent tries to banish or shuffle your relinquish
  Ritual Support
  • Manju of the Ten Thousand Hands: to try to get relinquished from your deck, most of the time your opponent will have an ash blossom or negate ready, use this card to bait it, then use your searcher cards to get what you want.
  • Pre-Preparation: bait a search negate then use this to go plus 1
Kaiju (2nd Engine)
  • Kaiju : is for monsters you can't normally deal with such as omni negates or untargetable monsters such as red eyes dark dragoon. just kaiju them or absorb them
You have a dark kaiju incase you need to swap out cards for allure of darkness *** tech option if you choose to do that you can banish golden eyes for a free SUCC
  • Interrupted Kaiju Slumber: dark hole if you need to board wipe potentially, or a bait card to use before searched, and when in graveyard, banish to search for a kaiju incase you need to get rid of an untargetable monster.
The kaijus are also use to generally absorb so running high atk kaijus is no problem. Extra Deck: 
  • Thousand-Eyes Restrict: Hard to protect, will most likely use instant fusion to get this one to absorb a monster from the opponent then will link to anima for another SUCC or as material for a link 2 monster.
  • Millenium-Eyes Restrict: The CORE of this deck, absorb up to 5 monsters which will negate their effects while equipped to it, and absorbs from the field or graveyard as a quick effect, meaning on hand trap activation you can absorb a copy from the graveyard to negate it or steal another higher attack monster as punishment for using hand traps. (one per turn but can get more via support cards)
  • Relinquished Anima : used to absorb another enemy monster after a Kaiju special summon (position them above link monster zones) then for link 2 or so on as a non destruction way to get rid of monsters.
  • Dharc: if your opponent has a dark monster, used to take 1 and link into Knightmare unicorn
  • Cross-Sheep: Either used to draw 2 discard 2 via ritual or for the fusion ability via a fusion or instant fusion if you need to get 2 material total extra for Dharc or Anaconda
  • Linguriboh : if you need to link golden-eyes into something other then anima or you need a trap negate.
  • Anaconda : Quickiest way to get relinquish fusion
  • Knightmare Unicorn: used to climb up into code talker or a non-destruction shuffle
  • Accesscode Talker: A win more card, or if you need a spell speed 4 destruction
Side Deck: Mostly options to steal monsters to link up faster, or draw more/ways to cut your deck smaller for more consistency or to get relinquished into your hands faster, you should have a good picture of what each card is for from here, along with the hand traps being used as fodder to use a fusion material in case you need an effect monster for Millennium-Eyes Restrict. *****(Dark Ruler No More is also a Tech Option if you deal with a lot of Opponents with a board full of monster effects with omni negates waiting)
Replays and combos:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u1OIG6HqMbw

deck_name: The Best Baronne De Fleur Deck - Tenyi Yang Zing
deck_excerpt: Tenyi always you to extend without much risk and with their secondary effects being able to be activated from the graveyard it allows you to play 4 D
deck_description:
This is a guide on how to play this archetype, the video will also show how to do the combos in real time.   Before we get into Objectives I do want to get into all the ways we can get into Crystron Halqifibrax . 
  1. Any tenyi monster special summon into turner normal summon. If the Tuner is Mecha Phantom Beast O-Lion make sure you link chain Halqifibrax at 1 and O-Lion at 2 to protect against Ash. 
  2. Jet Synchron into Salamangreat Almiraj then use jet Synchron to get into Crystron. (this will alter how your turns are played throughout the game though. Which is why I think adding Deskbot 001 and removing 1 O-Lion might be the move)
  3. any level 7 or lower monster summoned into Destrudo the lost Dragon's Frisson
  4. Any monster with Tenyi Spirit - Adhara special summon
  5. Tenyi Spirit Vishuda or Ashuna special summon, Link into Monk of the Tenyi, then Special summon Adhara.
  6. Last but not least the most Obscure way would be summoning any tuner monster and having your opponent effect veiler or Infinite Impermanence it then using The Iris Swordsoul's effect to special summon it to the field.
1st Objective of this deck is to Link summon into Crystron Halqifibrax , This will allow you to search out Jet Synchron which is you're main tuner to enable the combo. (Jet Synchron can be replaced with Deskbot 001 if you wish)  2nd Objective of this deck is to Link summon into Mecha Phantom Beast Auroradon, This will allow you to get 3 lv 3 tokens which will be important.  3rd Objective of this deck is to make Denglong, First of the Yang Zing , Use Auroradon's ability to sac 2 tokens(if you have a monk of tenyi on the field if not you want to sacrifice Auroradon and a token) to summon Mecha Phantom Beast O-Lion. You then will synchro summon into Denglong, First of the Yang Zing which doing so two triggers happen, stack Denglongs trigger first and follow it with Mecha Phantom Beast O-Lion's effect to protect against Ash. You want to grab Nine Pillars of Yang Zing with Denglong's effect. Then you want to use Denglong's activated effect to send a level 7 tenyi to the grave, if you do not have Tenyi Spirit - Ashuna in the graveyard send her. This will make Denglong into a level 7 tuner.  4th Objective of this deck is to make Baronne De fleur, Synchro summon using the level 7 Denglong, First of the Yang Zing and 1 level 3 token to make De fleur. Denglong's effect will activate when sent to the graveyard which in most cases you should grab Jiaotu, Darkness of the Yang Zing and set in defense position.  5th Objective of this deck is to make Draco Berserker of the Tenyi , Remember sending Ashuna to the graveyard? This is why, we need to activate jet synchrons effect to summon him back to the field first because if you activate ashuna first she will stop you from special summoning anything that isn't a Tenyi Monster. Then Remember why we sacrificed the link 3 instead of the token? because we need the token to activate ashuna. So now you activate Ashuna from the grave to special summon Tenyi Spirit - Vishuda from the deck. Use Vishuda and jet synchron to make Draco Berserker of the Tenyi Now unless your opponent has a ton of board breakers they now have to face against 2  Omni Negates and 1 Semi Monster Negate. This deck produces another Omni Negate if you open with Foolish Burial or Vessel for the Dragon Cycle as you send Chiwen, Light of the Yang Zing to the Graveyard. Doing this means when you use Nine Pillars of Yang Zing on your opponents card and destroy Jiaotu, Darkness of the Yang Zing, when you special summon Bi'An, Earth of the Yang Zing you can also bring back Chiwen, Light of the Yang Zing from the graveyard and with Bi'an's effect synchro summon on your opponents turn into Herald of the Arc Light.   As you can see the deck if very good and I urge everyone who is sick of being a Meta Slave to give the deck a try!
Will write later

deck_excerpt: My version of Darklord Despia in Master Duel after the first wave of Despia support. [April 2022]
deck_description:
Overview While Darklords were good before, they just got even better with the addition of Despias. We didn't get every piece of support for Despias, so this decklist will be subject to change for the future whenever it gets added. Why combine Darklords and Despias together? They complement each other! Aside from most of everything being Dark-Fairy monsters, Despia's fix the consistency issue that Darklords have, and Darklords in turn help swarm the field and carry out OTKs with their high attack points. In addition to that, the main tech card I use is Archlord Kristya . This card is a floodgate; it locks everyone out of special summoning- and more often than not will be an auto win if you can get it out whilst going first. Pros and Cons
  • Consistency 
  • High search and draw power
  • High potential to OTK
  • Ability to lock the board down
------------------------------------------------
  • Weak to effects that banish cards
  • Very little spell/trap removal and negation
  • Difficult to recover if your board gets broken
How Consistent? Your opening hand is very important since this deck has a tough time recovering later on if needed. Out of 100 opening hands (assuming going first with 5 starting cards) these were the results: Good Hands: 65/100 (65%)  -- hand has multiple draws and searches that could allow playing through handtraps and other negates. Okay Hands: 26/100 (26%) -- hand has a tech card or handtrap(s), but still has potential to search and draw. Bad Hands: 6/100 (6%) -- hand has very little or risky options (ie. allure of darkness and no dark monsters). Dead Hands: 3/100 (3%) -- can't do anything, forced to end turn. Overall, pretty consistent with only around a 10% of not having at least a decent hand. In general this deck performs better going first compared to second, but can function fine going second if needed. Key Cards and Combos Darklord Morningstar - Functions as both an extender and card destruction if used as fusion material for The First Darklord . Can combo with Indulged Darklord where it can swarm Darklords to your field depending on the number of effect monsters on your opponent's field. Can also be used as an Allure of Darkness target if there are no better options. Darklord Ixchel - One of the best Darklords in the deck. She does 3 things: draw from the deck, set up the grave, and can copy Darklord spell/traps from the graveyard. Depending on which spells/traps are in the grave, she can effectively be an extra searcher/extender/negation. Dramaturge of Despia - Summons itself to the field when used for fusion material and is a negate to anything summoned from the extra deck. Can be very useful for going into Rank 8 xyz monsters. Darklord Superbia - The best extender in the deck since its revival effect isn't once per turn. You do need to be careful not to miss the timing on the revival effect- quick effect copying a Darklord Contact from the graveyard will cause you to miss timing as well as using The First Darklord 's revival effect during a chain. To avoid this, use your revival effects from the hand and not during a chain. Superbia can also revive any fairy monster from the graveyard, including Archlord Kristya and Herald of Orange Light for synchro plays. Archlord Kristya - Your main floodgate of the deck; prevents both players from special summoning. More often than not- if you can manage to get Kristya on the field turn one while going first, it's an auto-win. If you're going second- you can also use Kristya as fusion material from the hand for your Despia fusions. Aluber the Jester of Despia - Your best searcher in the deck to search for your Despia spells and also has a graveyard effect. Indulged Darklord - Bit of a double edged sword since she gives your opponent a monster, but also functions as a decent searcher for Ixchel, Superbia, or Morningstar. Ideally would want to give your opponent Capricious Darklord , Darklord Nergal, or one of your Superbias. I don't currently run this in my deck, but she also combos pretty well with Super Polymerization . Keep in mind you are locked into only Fairy effects for the rest of the turn after using her effect. Darklord Nergal & Capricious Darklord - Nergal has the same copying effect as Ixchel and also gives you piercing damage while Capricious powers down your opponent's monsters when it gets sent to the graveyard. These are tech cards that can be substituted if needed. Bit situational, but I have won duels by beating over 0 ATK/DEF monsters. Herald of Orange Light - The only handtrap I currently run in this deck, it can protect your searchers from other handtraps and set up the grave. It's also a Light monster that can be used for Despia fusions. It also combos extremely well with Darklord Superbia and Baronne de Fleur . Despian Tragedy - Your best target for Allure of Darkness since it turns the card into a +1 for your hand. It can also recycle your Despia spells back to your hand if your field spell gets destroyed. The Sanctified Darklord - The only trap I run in this deck; it adds a bit more control and LP recovery. You can also use this trap on your own Archlord Kristya so that you can special summon monsters during your own turn. This can also be substituted for any other Darklord trap of your choosing. Darklord Rebellion is a good alternative if you want more spell/trap removal. The First Darklord - Your main beater and extender. Being able to summon him became insanely easy because of Despia, Theater of the Branded . He can potentially board wipe your opponent if you use Morningstar as material, else he makes an excellent extender being able to summon any fairy monster from the hand or graveyard. A good way to surprise your opponent is to quick effect summon Archlord Kristya during their turn. Despian Quaeritis - Reduces the ATK of any monster that isn't a level 8+ fusion monster down to 0. You can combo this effect with Numeron Dragon for an OTK if you aren't locked into only fusions for the turn. This effect can also combo with Apollousa where her ATK will reset to her original value even after having lost ATK from negating. Baronne de Fleur - A very powerful synchro monster as long as you aren't locked into fusions or fairy abilities for the turn. Ideally you want to summon her with Darklord Superbia and Herald of Orange Light . During your standby phase you can have her recycle Superbia from the grave- and it will in turn revive Orange Light from the grave as well and you'll be ready to summon her again. You can effectively loop this into summoning her during your turn for a free card pop and omni negate. Saryuja Skull Dread - As long as you aren't locked into only Fairy effects for the turn, this card can help facilitate you summoning Archlord Kristya. The draw 4 is too good to pass up since there isn't an easy way to search Kristya. Other Options
  • If you aren't keen on using Herald of Orange Light , PSY-Framegear Gamma is a good alternative since it's also a light monster (and a tuner).
  • Super Polymerization can combo with Indulged Darklord and is a great going second card.
  • Called by the Grave is another good hand trap to consider if you have the room for it. Keep in mind- the more handtraps you run, the more often you will brick; this type of deck relies on having plenty of resources.
  • Harpie's Feather Duster can be added to make up for the lack of spell/trap removal.
  • Artifact Lancea can help prevent your cards from getting banished. Despias usually don't mind being banished, but Darklords can't do anything while banished.

deck_name: Red Dragon Archfiends - Master Duel (Updated) - April 2022
deck_excerpt: Competitive Red Dragon Archfiends Deck - Resonators / Assault Mode (Master Duel)
deck_description:
My most recent fix of the Red Dragon Archfiend deck, this time making use of the Assault Mode engine alongside the original Resonators along with some other new cards.
  • Resonators - The Resonator engine is the original I've been using for the most part. Crimson is the best one here in my opinion, being able to almost singlehandedly summon Red Supernova Dragon on the first turn (if you don't get interrupted, of course). Red allows you to summon a 4* to pair to go into Red Rising. Synkron and Creation can special summon themselves. Chain can be used as intended if you want, but I use it as Light-attribute banish fodder for Chaos Ruler. You can replace it with basically any other Light monsters, even a Kaiju if you wanted to just have that at hand. Wildwind can special summon itself when a Resonator is on the field.
  • Assault Mode - The Assault Mode engine allows for some really quick and easy synchros, and works even better alongside Resonators. All the cards are pretty self-explanatory. Psi-Reflector can search and special summon Assault Mode monsters from the GY and manipulate their levels to go into the exact synchro you want. It's a lot more consistent than relying solely on Resonators, which can occasionally brick. Emergency Teleport is to get out a Psi-Reflector when you don't have it in hand.
  • Other Main Deck Monsters - Iron Dragon Tiamaton is there as a level 4 that special summons itself. It also has a niche but cool column destruction effect whenever it's summoned. You can replace this with something like Witch of the Black Forest (searches after going from Field to GY) or Skull Meister (level 4 GY-negate handtrap). I don't find those necessary as I feel the deck has enough searches, and Called By is just a better Skull Meister. If you want you can throw in a Kaiju, I would recommend Radian (level 7 Dark Fiend) or Thunder King (level 9 Light Thunder). Radian is better because it has low stats but Thunder King can be used as banish fodder for Chaos Ruler. Hydride is there to be summoned by Halqifibrax, I'll explain that later. Of course, I also run 2 Ash and Maxx C. 
  • Spells & Traps - Resonator Call is self explanatory, it searches for Resonators. Emergency Teleport is there to get out a Psi-Reflector for the Assault Mode engine.  Burning Soul is so you can Synchro summon on enemy turn if you want to, and it also provides targeting protection for Level ≤8 Synchros. It also fetches a card from the GY to your hand, so if you want to reuse a handtrap or if Chaos Ruler milled something like Assault Mode Activate or a handtrap, you can grab those back. Assault Mode Activate is just there for the Assault Mode engine, you'll never actually be placing it down. Imperm is a generic negate trap. Red Reign is absolutely amazing and self explanatory, it's a monster banish wipe except for the highest level monsters. 
  • Extra Deck - Samsara is there for coverage in case all you get is something like Synkron/Chain and Wildwind, or if you want to do some funky stuff into Supernova (I've done it a couple times, it's nice to have). Red Rising starts up most of the summon spam combos when not using Assault Mode. Scarlight is the basic Level 8 to go into cards like Abyss, Bane, King Calamity, Nova, or Supernova. Chaos Ruler can excavate the top 5 cards of your deck, take 1 Light or Dark monster, and then send the rest to the GY (which really isn't a bad thing in this deck, as a lot of cards have GY effects). Abyss is a free once-per-turn negate and can summon Resonators when it does damage. Bane can tribute a monster to summon a Red Dragon Archfiend monster from the GY, and can also summon Resonators when it does damage. King Calamity and Red Supernova are the powerhouses of the deck. In terms of how good they are, I think King Calamity < Red Supernova. Red nova is a pretty simple big beatstick, but it can't be destroyed by card effects and can negate an attack by temporarily banishing itself. King Calamity stops your opponent from activating cards the turn it's summoned. When it destroys a monster by battle, it does burn damage equal to that card's attack, which means if that monster was in attack position, you'll always be doing 4000 damage. It also revives a level 8 or lower Dark dragon Synchro when it dies so you won't be left open. Supernova is by far the best card in the deck. Huge beatstick that can banish wipe your opponents' entire field, and bring itself back in your next end phase, and as a cherry on top, it can't be destroyed by card effects. King Calamity has an advantage though, where because of the lockout effect, you can use Burning Soul or Shooting Riser to summon King Calamity during your opponents turn and completely lock them out of everything. You can replace Burning Soul with something like Synchro Call or Synchro Transmission if you want, I just like Burning Soul because it adds a later of protection in case I use it during my turn or if King Calamitys effect somehow gets negated. Halqifibrax is there for the dreaded all-Tuner brick hand. This way, at the very least you'll have a way to get at least 1 solid monster out. Get 2 tuners out, summon Halq, summon Hydride, then during your opponents turn proc Halq to summon Shooting Riser (Do / don't use it's effect, all depends what you want to go into) and use Shooting Riser + Hydride to go into either Baronne (if you didn't use Risers effect) or Chaos Ruler / Scarlight (if you used Risers effect and dumped a level 2). 
 
  • Side Deck / Replacement Cards - Most of these are just cards you can use to replace things you either don't have or don't want. Hat Tricker is an easy-to-use card you can just throw in there. Nibiru, Solemn Judgement, Lightning Storm, and Feather Duster are all good and generic cards if you want to switch things around (for example using CBTG instead of Skull Meister). Ancient Pixie and Zeta are both good level 7 Synchros in case you somehow brick with only something like Creation and Wildwind. I don't run these because it's such a small chance of that being your only play that it's negligible. Beelze and Dark End Dragon are both good replacements for Scarlight if you're not planning to run Nova (not a super important card anyway), especially Dark End Dragon. Dark End sends cards to the Gy rather than destroying them, which bypasses cards that "can't be destroyed". You can run Tyrant if you want to, I only run 13 cards because of the current D.D. Dynamite deck going around. Nethersoul Dragon is also another good Level 10 if you want one, with a plethora of good effects. Now, if you want to be really annoying, you can technically run the Very Fun Dragon. Abyss works as one of the level 9 materials, and you can either summon a second Abyss or run the Trishula fusion by banishing monsters, no poly needed so you don't need to change main deck cards around. But you'd have to somehow get 2 Abyss' out on one turn, then somehow have both of thems survive until the next turn where you'd XYZ summon. Not worth imo especially because you'd be cutting down the rest of your extra deck.
  Overall a super good and super fun deck. The previous deck I made got me to Plat, and this one's even better.

deck_excerpt: A Dragon Link variant featuring the Armed Dragon Thunder monsters.
deck_description:
Main Combo: Pile Armed Dragon + Armed Dragon Thunder Lv5/Lv7
  1. Special Summon Pile Armed Dragon by discarding Armed Dragon Thunder Lv5/Lv7
  2. Activate the effect of Armed Dragon Thunder Lv5/Lv7 in the GY to either
    1. If you discarded Armed Dragon Thunder Lv5, add Tempest, Dragon Ruler of Storms
    2. If you discarded Armed Dragon Thunder Lv7, add Armed Dragon Lv3
  3. Activate the effect of the Pile Armed Dragon on the field to send either Armed Dragon Thunder Lv5/Lv7, whichever you didn’t send and do the correlating part of Step 2
  4. Activate the effect of Tempest, Dragon Ruler of Storms in your hand and discard it and Armed Dragon Thunder Lv3 to add Black Metal Dragon to your hand, then resolve the effect of Armed Dragon Thunder Lv3 in your GY to draw 1 card
  5. Normal Summon Black Metal Dragon and link it off into Striker Dragon
  6. Activate Black Metal Dragon as Chain Link 1 and Striker Dragon as Chain Link 2 to add Red-Eyes Darkness Metal Dragon and Boot Sector Launch to your hand
  7. Banish Striker Dragon to Special Summon Red-Eyes Darkness Metal Dragon and use it to Special Summon Armed Dragon Thunder Lv7 to the field
  8. Link off Red-Eyes Darkness Metal Dragon and Pile Armed Dragon to summon Hieratic Seal of the Heavenly Spheres
  9. Activate the effect of Armed Dragon Thunder Lv7 to discard 1 monster and Special Summon Armed Dragon Thunder Lv10
This is the bread and butter combo, but as with every Dragon Link variant, every hand is different and you can play through a lot of interruption. A small Rokket package is included so that if you start with an above average hand, you can use Dragunity Knight - Romulus to search a Dragon Ravine to pitch an Absorouter Dragon to search a Rokket Tracer. By that point of the combo, you should have already gone into Striker Dragon for Boot Sector Launch. Only thing to do is to link off Dragunity Knight - Romulus and another Dragon into Hieratic Seal of the Heavenly Spheres to have a link in the GY for Borreload Savage Dragon. Important thing to note with the deck are the Small World bridges. Only ones you super need to worry about are making sure the second card is a Black Metal Dragon or a Droll & Lock Bird since that basically searches your entire deck.

deck_excerpt: Normal time thief/raidraptor shenanigans, with a pendulum engine for extra resiliency
deck_description: Alright, so if you don't know what these decks do, Prisco on YouTube has some great examples. Effectively, if you can summon 1 rank 4 + an extender, you have a board with 3-4 effect negates, 1 omni negate, 0-1 spell/trap negates, and 2 disruptions. It's gross, and super fun.  But, these builds struggle against any sort of interruption of your normal summon (ideally, this is regulator). That's why we run the gamma engine and called by. Is that enough to keep up with today's metagame? Absolutely not.  So, how to fix this? Take some inspiration from D/D/Ds and pendulum summon you some dark monsters to victory. We keep the deck super slim, running 4 spells and traps (all except 1 is searchable, how's that for consistency?). We also run Danger! Mothman to help unbrick your raider's wing/bezel ship, and Armageddon knight to dump one of those two after a pendulum summon (or normal + raider's wing). Even better, we have Curtain Raiser as a free special summon that can also be pendulum scaled with Supreme King Gate  When going second, they're probably going to s/t removal, so just get rid of the pendulums for some board breakers (which can include Forbidden Droplet/Lightning Storm, if you pay that much for cardboard). As an added bonus, D.D. crow is another dark winged beast, in addition to helping with scythe locks, this deck's worst enemy.  In the extra deck, the high level raidraptors can easily be subbed for abyss dweller/tornado dragon. Lambda can also be subbed for Omega, but searchable gamma is very nice.  This is budget AF, is super fun to play, and has great thematics behind its cards. Give it a spin.

deck_name: Xyz Trains - Master Duel - May '22 Update
deck_excerpt: Going Second Machine deck, focusing on breaking boards and running over your opponent with unstoppable Xyz Machine monsters.
deck_description: For those that already played this deck and are just interested in the changes, check the changelog at the bottom of this section. This is an OTK deck that wants to Go Second, interrupt of break your opponent's first turn plays and run them over in turn 2. The deck's main goal is to attack with a 6000 ATK Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Juggernaut Liebe with an Infinitrack Goliath as material, supported by Outrigger Extension, for an untargetable, undestructible OTK. Infinitrack Goliath can be Link Summoned by tributing any 1 Infinitrack monster and can be sent to the graveyard to trigger its attach effect by either one of the Level 5 Main Deck monsters, any of the Xyz Infinitracks already in the GY, or by linking it up to a Double Headed Anger Knuckle. You want to have a Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Gustav Max already summoned when you do this, something the whole deck is designed to turbo out in any way possible. Then you can Xyz Summon Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Juggernaut Liebe on top of the Gustav Max, activate its effect and attack for game. There are also a lot of handtraps and backrow removals to help you clear any inconveniences before you begin your plays. Super Polymerization is here to help deal with the meta's most annoying turn-1 play, Destiny HERO - Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer. Swordsouls always have a Baronne de Fleur on the field as well, our Idaten the Conqueror Star can use both of them as materials and is also Level 10. Despias have Masquerade the Blazing Dragon, our Starving Venom Fusion Dragon can use both of them (or another Despian if DPE is not on the field). Earth Golem @Ignister is the only guy that can see Apollousa, Bow of the Goddess as material and is remotely possible to be Fusion Summoned. Even if you draw Super Polymerization and there are no valid plays with it though, it can either bait an opponent removal effect or be used as discard fodder for Revolving Switchyard. Note 1: Be aware that although Outrigger Extension is a great piece of support for your Xyz Machines, its Rank-Up effect restriction can lock you out of Photon Strike Bounzer, Divine Arsenal AA-ZEUS - Sky Thunder and Super Polymerization. It can always be activated after these cards though, without problems. Infinitrack Brutal Dozer has the same restriction on its search effect. Note 2: There is a Side Deck section in this deck that lists a number of handtraps. These cards have all been tested and proven less useful against the meta, but they're still quite strong, and more importantly, they're quite strong against us. If you find yourself losing to any of them consistently, you can add a single copy of them into the deck as a target for Crossout Designator. May '22 Changelog It's the Destiny HERO - Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer era, and we have to adapt to it. Also, Swordsoul and Despia decks are everywhere and they're annoying, so it's time someone punishes their hype. - Ruffian Railcar and Flying Pegasus Railroad Stampede have been removed from the deck. They are both too slow for the current format. Both ended up just serving as Urgent Schedule targets, but since neither can link into an Infinitrack Goliath, they were suboptimal even then. - Infinitrack Anchor Drill went up to 3. A better Urgent Schedule target that the two above, also its NS effect can become a lot more relevant due to other additions in the deck that block Super Express Bullet Train's self SS effect. It's now the second main NS of the deck. - Night Express Knight cut down to 1. Takes up the NS of the turn, which is suboptimal and slows down the deck, also room was needed for more handtraps. Stayed to 1 instead of being removed completely because it's still a target for Revolving Switchward in a handtrap heavy opening hand that needs a way to trigger one of the other two Level 10 SS. - Infinitruck Tunneler removed from the deck. It was the least useful Level 5 Infinitruck and the space was needed. - Outrigger Extension down to 1 and 3 Heavy Forward added. Outrigger is searchable and its searcher is also searchable. Heavy Forward is 3 more Infinitrack Harvester, or any other Infinitrack if you already have the short dude. - Nibiru, the Primal Being, Evenly Matched and Infinite Impermanence have been removed from the deck. While still exceptionally good cards, I have noticed them impact less games less heavily in the current format. Also read "Note 2" for more on this. - 2 Called by the Grave and 3 Crossout Designator added to the deck. These are mainly handtrap protection, they support the OTK capabilities of the deck immensely. Called by the Grave can also interrupt plays and remove Destiny HERO - Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer, albeit after its destruction effect. Crossout Designator can block any card you happen to have in your deck, and since we also play a heavy amount of destruction spells, this is probably the most useful handtrap in the deck now. - 2 Super Polymerization added to the deck, along with 3 Fusion and 1 Link targets, Starving Venom Fusion Dragon, Earth Golem @Ignister, Salamangreat Almiraj and Idaten the Conqueror Star. This engine is the best board breaker of the current meta. Let's admit it, Destiny HERO - Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer is everywhere now. Idaten the Conqueror Star is the heavy lifter against Swordsouls, since they also go to a Baronne de Fleur, he can use both of these as materials. Starving Venom Fusion Dragon is the star against Despia and can also out the Enforcer in any deck that brings him with Predaplant Verte Anaconda, since they're both Dark. Earth Golem @Ignister coupled with Salamangreat Almiraj can out any Link monster (I'm looking at you, Apollousa, Bow of the Goddess). Almiraj does need either a normal summoned Infinitrack Harvester or a Night Express Knight, so there goes the turn's NS. - 1 Photon Strike Bounzer added to the Extra Deck. There will be a lot of times that you'll end up with both an Infinitrack Anchor Drill and an Infinitrack Harvester in the field. Using either of their on-field effects on the other can result in a Rank 6 play, and this dude can block a negate/destruction monster effect to help you get to Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Juggernaut Liebe easier. It does block Super Express Bullet Train's ability to SS itself though, so keep that in mind (and hence 3 Infinitrack Anchor Drills now in deck). - Cyber Dragon engine removed from the Extra Deck and Infinitrack Goliath went down to 1. There are only 3 Level 5 Infinitrucks in the deck now, and our first Rank 5 play is always through an Infinitrack Brutal Dozer search that restricts us to Earth Machine monsters. It was rarely used and the room was needed. A second Goliath was also rarely used, and the deck can live without it if it already went through enough interruption to be able to use it. Again, room was needed.

deck_excerpt: I made this deck just for fun. The Extra Deck was being weird and I couldn't put anything in it, so just pretend the Side Deck is the Extra Deck.
deck_description: Juragedo, Jester Confit, Cyber Dinosaur, Cyber Dragon, and Interplanetarypurpleythorny Dragon all special summon themselves. Phantom Skyblaster gets tokens, Ra's Disciple special summons more of itself, and so does Nimble Momonga, with Nimble Beaver to help. Mare Mare can quickly go into Clear Wing Synchro Dragon while Reactor Slime summons tokens and sets Metal Reflect Slime to go into either Egyptian God Slime, Galaxy-eyes Cipher X Dragon, or Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Gustav Max to go into Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Juggernaut Leibe. Number 45: Crumble Logos the Prophet of Demolition and Tornado Dragon can go into Divine Arsenal AA-ZEUS - Sky Thunder. Soul Crossing, Soul Exchange, and The Monarchs Stormforth all help tribute your opponents monsters to go into Obelisk the Tormentor on either player's turn. Card Advance combos with The True Name, Double Summon and Arrivalrivals provide extra summons, and Fist of Fate and Raigeki both destroy all of your opponents monsters. Finally, One-Time Passcode, March of the Monarchs, World Legacy Clash, Sky Striker Mecha - Widow Anchor, Divine Evolution, and Ultimate Divine-Beast all generally help the deck.

deck_excerpt: The Subterror archetype specializes in flip effects and is built around control. For full combos, watch: https://youtu.be/7l4tSsSC7DU
deck_description: Subterror Behemoth Umastryx's effect is an optional effect (You Can) that starts with "When" which means it will miss activation if another event happens after "When a face-up monster you control is flipped face-down". Subterror Final Battle won't trigger Subterror Behemoth Umastryx's effect. Its text says "Activate 1 of these effects, also, after that, Set this card face-down instead of sending it to the GY". Because the text has "after that", another event is taking place after changing 1 face-up "Subterror" monster on the field to face-down Defense Position. The conjunctives "then" and "also, after that" indicate that the part of the effect before it is done strictly before the part of the effect after it, and so effects that could be activated in response to the event before the conjunctive miss the timing. On the other hand, the conjunctives "and", "and if you do" and "also" indicate that both the parts before and after it are done simultaneously. Therefore, no effect is taking place after it. You can use Subterror Guru & Subterror Fiendess to trigger Subterror Behemoth Umastryx's effect. Other trap card you can use is Ice Dragon's Prison. https://youtu.be/7l4tSsSC7DU

deck_name: Branded Despia - Post Structure Deck: Albaz Strike
deck_description: https://youtu.be/fHcE6U3x7FU

This is a Prank-Kids Kaiju list, with a trimmed down Prank-Kids package. The Kaiju are here for removal, both with Interrupted Kaiju Slumber and with the base Kaiju effects. We include one copy of Kyoutou Waterfront to search Kaiju, or potentially activate our Kaiju abilities after summoning them off of Interrupted Kaiju Slumber. This deck fills up the graveyard pretty quickly so we play Pot of Avarice to recurse key resources like Meow-Meow-Mu. Instant Fusion, One For One, and Monster Reborn all help up to play through disruption on our Prank-Kids effects. We are main-decking There Can Be Only One, since we can play around it with relative ease, and it floodgates a fair number of decks. We use Effect Veiler instead of Infinite Impermanence so we can link into Linkuriboh.

deck_description: Core Strategy -Deck isn't really made to win but more to be a jerk while losing Bosses - 2 tributes -Vanity's Ruler: turns off opponent's special summons -Amaterasu: needs to be tribute set, on flip banishes all other cards on field. also gets flipped by being targeted Tribute Enablers -Mausoleum of the Emperor: pay 1k instead of each tribute -Star Blast: reduce level of a monster in hand by 1 per 500 lp paid (allows for single tribute summons instead of all or nothing) -Angel O1: reaveal level 7 or higher in hand to special summon and grant an extra tribute summon Condemned Witch plays Normal Condemned Witch, searches either Forbidden Chalice or Forbidden Lance On opponent's turn tribute Condemned Witch to SS Barrier Statue of the Heavens (or Aurora Paragon if up against a Light Attribute deck)

deck_excerpt: Yes, another Branded deck, cry about it. Imagine using an overpriced token engine with no DARK or more importantly LIGHT targets for a Fusion deck tha
deck_description:
Hi, Grayewick the Fusionist here, back with another Branded list despite already posting a ton of it but because love this deck and I'm fucking sick and tired of people messing it the fuck up despite how hard it is to be bad at building a "Super Poly the deck" list and how straightforward of a deck it is to build despite being a Fusion toolbox deck. I hate redundancy, I despise it, but I hate seeing this deck be bastardized by questionable yet objectively terrible decisions even more. "Why play this deck?" • It can turbo out Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon without Verte or REF. Do I need to say more? • It can make DPE without Verte. Do I need to say even more? • It abuses Super Polymerization. • It can survive without the Brave Token engine. Before anything else, I wanna preface this with 1. There's being a good pilot and there's being a good deck builder, and that involves knowledge about what's in number 2, 2. Not because you can do what I'm about to warn you about in number 3, doesn't mean you should, and 3. DO NOT FUCKING PLAY THIS DECK WITH BRAVE TOKENS. I do not care if you see someone have a topping list that does otherwise, in theory it works great because "hurr durr b-but free recurring omni negate opt", but you know what does the job the same but better in practice? Fucking Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon. Not to mention that you're doing yourself a disservice by using up 9 slots in your main deck for an engine, where 4 of which are monsters, and none of which are either LIGHT or DARK. I do not give a fuck if your favorite content creator tells you otherwise, I do not care if a list that uses it topped a BO1 event (any deck can so long as either they're lucky enough in the matchmaking, plays a silver bullet strategy, or uses tons of floodgates), I've been testing this deck since Despia and Albaz first came out and all I can guaran-fucking-tee you is THIS DECK NEEDS MORE LIGHT TARGETS, SO DO NOT KILL IT BY SPLASHING BRAVE TOKENS JUST BECAUSE OF THE FREE NEGATE. You can go test it out yourself but when you do, all I can say is have fun shooting yourself in the foot. Anyway, the list. The Main Deck: Monsters • The Despians (Dramaturge, Ad Libitum, Aluber, Tragedy, & Comedy) - Can't play the deck without them. Stuff they do:
  1. Dramaturge - Main deck boss monster. Can recycle himself when sent to GY or is banished as Fusion material. Has a targeting negation effect when an Extra Deck monster is special summoned (not just from the Extra Deck). You can play more than 1 but 3 can be bricky.
  2. Ad Libitum - One of the reasons you can grind and recycle. This can bring back a banished Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon or Destiny HERO - Destroyer Phoenix Enforcer or in your GY upon getting sent to the GY or is banished as Fusion material. Also has an ok ATK boosting effect that can be relevant occasionally. You can play more than 1 but 3 can be bricky. You can recycle him with your Albaz Fusions anyway.
  3. Aluber - He's your main Normal Summon in the deck and THE REASON WHY YOU DO NOT PLAY THE GODDAMN BRAVE TOKENS IN THIS DECK BECAUSE IT'S COUNTERPRODUCTIVE TO HIM. He also has a targeting negation effect in the GY when a Fusion monster you control is either destroyed by battle or leaves the field because of an opponent's card effect. I only play 2 because I already know how the deck plays but you can most certainly play 3 by cutting anything but the 1 ofs, except for Despian Tragedy & Despian Comedy.
  4. Tragedy - Playing 3 of this enables you to play draw cards like Allure of Darkness. I do not understand why people only play 1 of this considering how this is your main searcher. I don't recommend cutting this.
  5. Comedy - Utility 1 of. Archetypal hand trap to protect your Despia monsters from targeting effects, also allows your Fusion monsters to dodge your opponent's targeting effects while it's in the GY. Feel free to cut this.
• Fallen of Albaz - Your other relevant Normal Summon in the game. Super Polymerization on legs but can be responded. Regardless, weaker Super Poly is still Super Poly. You can set this against Dragon decks and contact fuse for Abyssal Dragon Alba Renatus. • Incredible Ecclesia, the Virtuous - Can special summon herself. Brings out Fallen of Albaz from the Deck. Also a LIGHT target for Branded Fusion. • Magicians' Souls + Dark Magician - The main reason why you can bring out Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon faster than Verte turbo decks. Also a great Ash Blossom bait. • Artifact Lancea - LIGHT target, which the deck DESPERATELY NEEDS. A Fairy, for the purposes of summoning The First Darklord. And you can always shotgun this against your opponent to cut off their brave token engine. Could be any hand trap, so long as they're LIGHT, DARK, or Ash Blossom. Spells • Allure of Darkness - Banishing DARK monsters face-up is not a problem, your Fusion monsters can recycle them anyway. Also pair this with Despian Tragedy for a +1. • Branded Fusion - Yes, my Fusion Spell uses materials from the Deck, cry about it. • Fusion Destiny - Yes, my Fusion Spell uses materials from the Deck, cry about it. • Gold Sarcophagus & Foolish Burial - You're almost always dumping Tragedy with either. Gold Sarc is just better because it plays around Ash. • Branded Opening - The reason why I prefer playing less copies of Aluber, because I can summon him off of this anyway. Also, if you pitch Tragedy with its effect, or if you play a Branded Shaddolls variant, you can chain block Aluber from getting Ashed. • Super Polymerization - You literally have no reason to not play this card. All of your Fusion monsters are Super Poly targets. • Despia, Theater of the Branded - Your main search target for Aluber. One of the three reasons why you can summon Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon in this deck, and also the main reason why it is so worth it to play in this deck, because it can bring him or any Level 8 or higher Fusion monster back from the GY when a non-Fusion Fairy monster you control is either destroyed by battle or was removed from the field by an opponent's card effect. Feel free to cut it to 1, but it's always good to have insurance in case it gets banished. Traps • Branded Exile - Searchable Call of the Haunted for Despia monsters or Level 8 or higher Fusion monsters, and can also be a Super Polymerization on resolution in the form of a Trap. I hope you can start to see a pattern now why Super Poly is a MUST HAVE in a deck like this. • Branded Condemnation - Searchable Solemn Warning that can also be used to recycle your Branded Spells/Traps by banishing itself. Feel free to bump it up to 3 or cut it down to 1 if you prefer. The Extra Deck: • The First Darklord - Honorary boss monster. Gives all your Fairies effect targeting protection, can also bring any Fairy monster in your GY OPT. A cute interaction you can do is summon him using Artifact Lancea as Fusion Material and Special Summon it during your opponent's Main Phase and Tribute it for its effect. • Despian Proskenion - Despia boss monster, supposedly. Has a neat effect of either stealing or banishing an opponent's Extra Deck monster in the GY, also burns your opponent equal to the original ATK or DEF of a monster it destroys by battle, whichever was higher. Great Super Poly target. • Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon - This deck has absolutely NO REASON not to play Dragoon in this deck. It's a Towers boss monster that you can bring out without using Verte Anaconda or Red-Eyes Fusion, which are both the problematic parts of summoning him, has the same omni negate the racist tokens provide, except it's also a Level 8 Fusion monster that has FULL SYNERGY WITH YOUR DECK, UNLIKE THEM EXPENSIVE ASS TOKEN ENGINE, can opt pop a monster your opponent controls and burn it, and can be brought back with either Ad Libitum or Theater. This is the main reason why I am compelled to make this list even when I've already made like five or more iterations of this deck, all of which have Dragoon and I have tested against post-DIFO decks and survived well enough. • The Branded Dragons (Mirrorjade, Lubellion, Alba Renatus, Masquerade, Titaniklad, & Albion) - The stars of the show, all Super Poly targets with the following effects:
  1. Mirrorjade - Your most forgiving Super Poly target. Can once per every other turn, banish a monster on the field without targeting at a cost of sending a Fusion monster that lists "Fallen of Albaz" in its text from your Extra Deck to the GY. Also destroys all monsters your opponent controls during the End Phase of the turn it leaves the field.
  2. Lubellion - One of the main reasons this deck can recycle. It Fusion Summons at a cost of a discard by shuffling the materials of that Fusion monster from your GY or banished to the deck. The second reason you can summon Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon in this deck.
  3. Alba Renatus - The Chimeratech Fortress Dragon/Invoked Purgatrio of the Deck. It can search ANY Polymerization or Fusion Normal Spell from your Deck the turn it was sent to the GY.
  4. Masquerade - The bane of combo decks. Makes your opponent pay taxes in LP for each time they attempt to activate a card or effect. This effect is not a once per copy, so having two of him stacks, bumping it up from 600 to 1200 LP per card or effect activation.
  5. Titaniklad - Your main fodder for Mirrorjade, except this time, you won't be searching for a Dogmatika monster, but Special Summoning Fallen of Albaz instead as an interruption.
  6. Albion - Ideally you'll be summoning him first before Lubellion, but he's the third reason you can summon Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon in this deck. It Fusion Summons without a cost by banishing the materials of that Fusion monster from your hand, field, and/or GY. It also sets you a Branded Spell/Trap from your Deck if it is sent to the GY this turn, ideally either Branded Exile for additional interruption or Branded Condemnation for protection.
• El Shaddoll Winda - This deck can make Winda, so why the hell not. Also stops Brave Tokens from bringing out the chicken. • Starving Venom Fusion Dragon & Predaplant Dragostapelia - Generic Super Poly targets, one of which has a pretty relevant interruption/floodgate effect. Final Thoughts #1. Don't play it with them Brave Tokens. Not because you can, doesn't mean you should. #2. This deck needs LIGHT targets, not overpriced engine that does nothing more for the deck. You'd be much better off running Kaijus instead. Speaking of which, if you want a free omni negate but also want a LIGHT target, just play Invoked in this deck, simple. #3. I also have a 60 card list of Branded Dogmatika Invoked Shaddolls, I do not know who wants to see it or whether I should also post that or not. I'm just saying. #4. If your deck can abuse Super Poly, there's no reason not to do it while it's still at 3. #5. If your deck can abuse BOTH Dragoon and DPE, there's no reason not to do it while they're still both legal. Overall, not to be a Conspiracy Carl but I'm starting to think that people just love to hate Fusions (and Pendulums), but if all it takes for the prices of Branded cards and Structure Deck to go down is for them to be boycotted and propagandized as being terrible, I'll take it. For now, I'll still categorize this list as a "non-meta deck". As per usual, if you have any questions or thoughts, feel free to express them down in the comments and I'll respond to them as soon as I possibly can.

gods

Okay, so I made this deck a while back and figured I should share it somewhere. This is a fairly consistent FTK that abuses Superancient Deepsea King Coelacanth, which I have thought for a long time is strong enough to be banned, so I set out to find a way to break it, and I think this is it. There is just so much about this deck that happens to work out so perfectly, it's honestly kind of crazy. The FTK goes like this:  -Get any 2 level 4 monsters on the field with a Coelacanth in the grave (Leaffish does this, as well as a discard of Coelacanth to summon White Stingray, or Foolish. Summoner Monk does this by itself if you summon Leaffish.)  -Make Dugares and Summon Coelacanth  -Activate Coelacanth summoning specifically Gluttonous Reptolphin Greethys, a Royal Swamp Eel, and any other 2 Level 4s.  -Summon Halq, bring out your Lv 1 Dark Dragon tuner (specifically Dark Dragon, the Rokket one works too), and synchro with Coelacanth to make Beelze in either the leftmost or middle main monster zone (important for Geonator Transverser.)  -Link Halq and one of the 4s to make Geonator Transverser so that it points to Beelze  -Use the Reptolphin and the last Lv 4 to make White Aura Monoceros to bring back Coelacanth  -Activate Coelacanth again (yes, it's a soft once per turn) and summon a Royal Swamp Eel and Beautunaful Princess  -Make Garden Rose Maiden and search Black Garden and Activate it  -Overlay Monoceros and Coelacanth, who are both 7s, to make Red Eyes Flare Metal Dragon, which will trigger Black Garden. Put the Token into the other Geonator Transverser Zone.  -Switch control of Beelze and the Token, then link the token for Link Spider.  -Link away Transverser, Garden Rose Maiden, and Link spider for Agave Dragon, which will burn for 100 because of the Dragon Tuner you used to make Beelze, triggering the Beelze/Flare Metal interaction which will FTK your opponent.  I haven't actually played this deck in any super competitive format, so I don't know how good it actually is. I have Crossout and a few garnets for it since after the FTK tools the deck space is pretty free. I think in theory this deck is insane, so try it out sometime, but like I said, I haven't actually played it in a competitive environment.

deck_excerpt: ABC Union Deck for Master Duel - Big Robots and Blowing Stuff Up
deck_description: Planned deck for an ABC deck. Should work but I need to tweak it a little. Ojamas work really well with ABC but I wanted to keep it purely Union-based, plus I don't like the playstyle of the Ojama version. Basically just get A-to-Z Dragon Buster Cannon out and you'll have an insanely strong wincon. Its effect is extremely similar to Herald of Ultimateness, but A2Z doesn't feel nearly as cheesy and has better stats. Herald requires Fairies, A2Z can discard any card. On the other hand, Herald can also negate Summons. A2Z can also banish itself to bring back ABC and XYZ. That's why I run two A2Z, because if you split it up and don't have something like Transmodify, you can't get it back like you can with ABC and XYZ. Colossus is there because Nemeses Corridor can just generally help in the first place AND allows you to summon TD Colossus. Say you banish A2Z and bring back ABC/XYZ to stop it from being destroyed by battle or something; now you can use Nemeses, bring A2Z back to the Extra Deck, summon Colossus, and use ABC/XYZ to once again summon A2Z.

deck_excerpt: The powers of P.U.N.K. and Psy-Frame combine to make a deck that's... adequate!
deck_description: This was a deck originally inspired by Grandsoil Psychics, a competitive deck from back in the Synchro Era. Sadly, not many of the cards used then are still applicable in modern Trinity and many were cut during the extended deck tinkering (sadly, Grandsoil was one of those casualties), so the deck is now a soup of engines with lots of micro-synergies. PUNK is perhaps the best out of the bunch, offering a good foundation of advantage and disruption to build on, plus a big finisher with the level 11 Synchro. Psy-Frames are the next big engine - warping the style of gameplay for both players, but sadly at a loss of consistency. Psy-Frames thrive on an empty field, which informed a lot of the S/T choices. Rounding out the deck are support pieces that assist with Earth, Psychic, or the Psy-Frame gameplan. Personal standouts for me include Linkslayer, Sauge de Fleur, Psychic Feel Zone, and the duo of Psy-Framelord Omega and Virtual World Shenshen. They can both put back your banished monsters, which makes the Psy-Frame drawback of banishing your Drivers far less impactful - on top of being great bosses in their own right. Give this a try if you want to have some unorthodox fun, or explore some off the wall cards. Trinites: 4 .5p - Sauge de Fleur, Mind Control, Lightning Storm, Dark Hole  1p - Virtual World Kyubi - Shenshen, PSY-Framegear Alpha (duplicate)

deck_excerpt: The biggest bois doing the beeg damage and winning bigly.
deck_description: There are a few strategies with this deck but mainly this deck is focused around going second and trying to OTK your opponent. It can go first but it is definitely not optimized to. In terms of how viable it is, I would put it a little lower than the average Blue-Eyes engine in Master Duel. In general, the idea is to try and get one of your big, bad synchro monsters out onto the field, and if that isn't possible than at least get Benki out onto the field. There are some effect negations in the form of Ash Blossom, Soulbang, Soul Beads and Flutist. I made this deck for Master Duel so the idea to have 3 Maxx Cs in the deck is a necessity for almost every deck that wants to go second. Battleball and the Kaiju in this deck have the most interesting interaction since they can be used to easily summon either your big boss Train synchro or your Susanowo, but both cards in general are useful since all of your boss monsters overpower the Kaiju and Battleball can still synchro summon while removing one of the monsters on your opponents side of the field (Note; Battleball's effect is counted as tributing, but you have to target your opponents monster).  In terms of clearing your opponents board, you have Kaijus, the Train (Discard two cards to target and destroy two cards), Ogre (The Red Synchro monster which is basically Harpie's Feather Duster), and Sarutobi (Get rid of one spell or trap + some burn damage). The only one that you'll probably abuse is Ogre, so feel free to run 3 of them if you want.  There's a lot of cool stuff in this deck but honestly, it isn't the greatest. There's a lot this cards can do, but there isn't really any consistent effect negation of any kind and also can be easily negated itself. It also usually can't OTK, and takes 2 turns to kill. If you wanna run a more consistent OTK deck, run Numeron or plenty of other better archetypes. I did get to Diamond with this deck, but that was after a lot of trial and error.
