"A Synchro Monster that used this card as a Synchro Material cannot be destroyed by battle."

- A Yang Zing Monster probably

  Frustrated that your Arc Light always get beaten up by some Normal Summoned monsters because your opponent actually knows how to use their BP properly? Doesn't like that you have to play 2 Yang Zings in order to fully take advantage of Nine Pillars? Well, in this NEW HalqDon Combo, not only does your Yang Zing float to a Handtrap, but your Arc Light is also CANNOT BE DESTROYED BY BATTLE. Inspired by the Brave Tenyi from the OCG and B.A.S.E.D. from the TCG, I have created a similar Deck (The TCG/OCG has Swordsoul so its different okay). Through its Full Combo, you will end with the same board as the old Halq Combo, except instead of a random Yang Zing that doesn't really do anything, you will have Chaofeng which can search a Handtrap when destroyed by Nine Pillars or lock your opponent from using effects of a specific Attribute, also your Arc Light is indestructible by battle. And yeah Baronne(ss) is there too... (Why did the TCG remove the ss from Baron?). So anyway, here's the Combo and Deck Breakdown.

Combo

There's only one combo that you need to know really, it's basically Baronne + Halq (Ashuna/Vishuda + Red Rose Dragon)
  1. Ashuna/Vishuda Effect to Special themself -> Normal Summon Red Rose Dragon
  2. Synchro into Baronne -> Red Rose Dragon Special Roxrose Dragon from Deck -> Search Basal Rose Shoot
  3. Activate Basal Rose Shoot to Special Red Rose Dragon from GY -> Link 2 Rose Dragons into Halqifibrax -> Special Deskbot 001
  4. Link Halq and 001 into Auroradon -> Special 3 Tokens -> Special Deskbot 001 from GY
  5. Synchro 2 Tokens and Deskbot 001 into Yazi -> Baronne pop Yazi -> Float into Mare Mare
  6. Mare Mare Special a Token (1) -> Auroradon Tribute itself and Mare Mare Token to Special O-Lion from Deck
  7. Synchro Token and O-Lion into Denglong -> Search Nine Pillars
  8. Mare Mare Special another Token (2) -> Denglong Send Ashuna/Vishuda to become Lvl 7
  9. Synchro Denglong and Mare Mare Token into Borreload (On the EMZ, otherwise you won't have enough slot) -> Equip Auroradon -> Denglong float into Bi'an
  10. Mare Mare Special the last Token (3) -> Synchro Mare Mare and Mare Mare Token into Accel Synchron
  11. Accel Synchron Send Jet Synchron to increase Level -> Synchro Accel Synchron and a Token into Chaofeng
  12. Jet Synchron Effect to Special itself from GY -> Synchro Jet Synchron and Bi'an into Arc Light
And there you go, 4 Omnis + Handtrap search (Ash, Veiler, or Ghost Ogre) and your opponent can't attack over Arc Light anymore. You know what that means? DROPLET AND DARK RULER CAN'T COUNTER YOU LETS GOOO. Still vulnerable to Kaiju and Super Poly though. Alternatively, if you already use Baronne to negate on your own turn, you can leave Bi'an on the field. Baronne can bring back Denglong and Bi'an can Quick Synchro with it into Baxia. That's Unicorn for 2. If you happen to have a certain grudge against DARK Attribute, you can Special Taotie instead of Bi'an, and decrease Accel Synchron's Level instead. With this, you can Synchro into Chaofeng that locks your opponent from using DARK monsters effect. Then, you can Ashuna Effect to Special Mapura from Deck and Synchro into Draco Berserker. Or if you hate Adamancipator with passion, you can give up Arc Light battle protection to lock your opponent from using EARTH monsters effect with Bi'an + Accel Synchron = Chaofeng. For LIGHT monsters, you can use Baxia + Adhara/Jet Synchron (Adhara can be Special by Ashuna if you control a Token). But, not locking your opponent is actually the best choice, since you have to pop Chaofeng with Nine Pillars eventually (Arc Light battle protection is more important). And yes, I won't give you a different Combo so you can actually learn the Deck for yourself by practicing. The Combo of this Deck varies, depending on your hand and opponent's interaction.

Deck Breakdown

Instead of using a long list like before, I will group cards into paragraphs instead. This way it's easier to explain cards with similar effects/usage.

Main Deck

3x Tenyi Spirit - Ashuna; 3x Tenyi Spirit - Vishuda; 3x Tenyi Spirit - Adhara; 1x Tenyi Spirit - Mapura

These Tenyi are your starters as you can Special them for FREE if you control no Effect monsters. Ashuna and Vishuda are Level 7 which are perfect for Baronne as you have plenty of Level 3 Tuners on the Deck. Adhara is just a free Tuner to use for Halqifibrax and Mapura is the worst one. Additionally, these Tenyi monsters have an extra effect if you control a non-Effect monster, which in this Deck, you have a bunch of Tokens and the Extra Deck Tenyi: Monk of the Tenyi is also a non-Effect monster. You can banish them from your HAND (and yes people do forget that you can use it from hand) or GY. Ashuna Special a Tenyi from Deck but locks you into Wyrm for the rest of the turn. Vishuda can bounce a card your opponent controls. Adhara can add back a banished Wyrm. And Mapura can negate an effect that targets your non-Effect monsters.

So, why do I play Mapura? Well, it's because it's Level 4 which I need for Ashuna Effect. Shthana is actually a much better choice as it has a better effect where you can crash your Monk to a monster and revive it back while popping a monster your opponent controls (worse Vishuda basically). But due to Mare Mare being a WATER, I have to play a different Attribute so Baxia can shuffle 2 cards instead of 1.

3x Red Rose Dragon; 1x Roxrose Dragon; 1x Basal Rose Shoot

This is the Rose Dragon Package/Engine. When Combined with Ashuna/Vishuda, you can get a FREE Halq after Summoning Baronne. Red Rose float into Roxrose from hand or Deck when used as Synchro Material and Roxrose Search Basal Rose when Summoned which can Special a Rose Dragon from hand or GY.

I'm playing 3 Red Rose because you absolutely want to Normal Summon it every single game. Only 1 Roxrose and 1 Basal Rose because they are searchable that you will only use once and probably don't want to draw them. They aren't bricks, but you would rather Search them instead and have a different card in your hand.

2x Mecha Phantom Beast O-Lion; 1x Deskbot 001; 1x Mare Mare; 1x Jet Synchron

These are your most important Combo Pieces that you don't want to draw no matter what. 001 is your Halq target, it allows you to climb into Auroradon while reviving itself after. O-Lion is your Auroradon 2nd Effect target, not only it's a Level 2 Tuner, it also replace itself with a Token when sent to GY. Mare Mare is my favorite one, it can ONLY be Special Summoned by a Wyrm monster's Effect, which we have Yazi for that. Giving you a free 3 Level 1 Tokens for some insane Synchro Plays while also being a Level 4 Tuner after that. Lastly we have Jet Synchron, can be sent from Deck to GY with Accel Synchron, then can revive itself from GY by sending a card from hand to GY (doesn't count as discard btw, so can't do it under something like Arc Light or Dimensional Fissure).

I'm playing 2 O-Lion because O-Lion is THAT important and is pretty much dead most of the time if you draw it. The other 3 are 1 ofs. If you draw Mare Mare, that's fine because you can still Combo without Mare Mare. Same with Jet Synchron. 001 however, is still alive if you draw it since Halq can Summon from hand, but you rather draw something else.

1x Bi'an, Earth of the Yang Zing; 1x Taotie, Shadow of the Yang Zing; 1x Nine Pillars of the Yang Zing

These are your targets for Denglong Effect. Denglong can Search Nine Pillars on Summon and Float into Bi'an or Taotie when sent to GY. Bi'an is a Level 3 and Taotie is a Level 5. When they're destroyed, they can float into each other from Deck only. Unfortunately both Special in DEFENSE and both have 0 DEF, but that's alright since we play them solely for their Level. Bi'an however, has an extra Effect, giving battle protection when used as Synchro Material while Taotie prevents your opponent from stealing the Synchro. You can also Quick Synchro them with Denglong during your opponent's turn to go into Baronne, Baxia, or Borreload even. You can change Taotie for another copy of Bi'an since Denglong can only Special from Deck and not hand too. But I like having 2 different Yang Zing so that they can float. Then we have Nine Pillars, the Omni-Negate Counter Trap that only live if you control a Yang Zing (The then Effect is mandatory and needed)

3x Sangan; 1x Crusadia Arboria; 1x Destrudo the Lost Dragon's Frisson

Arboria and Destrudo are Extenders while Sangan is a starter. You can Normal Summon Sangan and Link it into Almiraj in order to search Arboria, or a Handtrap if you already have Arboria. Then you can go Halq after. You can also use Sangan to chain Block Halq if you decided to NOT go for the 1 card Combo and instead Summon another monster (Tuner) and go directly into Halq. You can also use Arboria and a Tenyi to go into Halq without committing to your Normal Summon. Destrudo serves the same purpose, except you can't use it on Level 7+ monsters which Ashuna/Vishuda are, or a Link Monster.

I'm playing 3 Sangan because it's a 1 card Halq. If you don't open Red Rose, you can try using E-Tele instead to make Baronne then Normal Summon Sangan into Full Combo. Only playing 1 Arboria because it's searchable with Sangan. And only 1 Destrudo because Destrudo is just there if you fail your Combo due to opponent's disruptions and doesn't actually save you if Halq/Auroradon got negated. Also Destrudo is a Free Yazi.

3x Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring; 3x Ghost Ogre & Snow Rabbit; 3x Effect Veiler; 3x Maxx "C"; 2x Emergency Teleport (E-Tele)

These are your main Handtraps. You probably already knows what Ash, Veiler, and Maxx "C" does so I'm not gonna explain it here. Ghost Ogre however, is a Handtrap you don't normally see (or see it everyday if you play TCG). It's Effect is not bad, it's just not good enough to be played over Ash or Veiler. Ghost Ogre not only serves as a Handtrap, it's also an Extender with E-Tele as it's a Level 3 Tuner Psychic. Not only that, you can use Ghost Ogre not only from your hand, but also field. So, if you don't need to extend with E-Tele, you can just Set it and Summon Ghost Ogre on your opponent's turn and still use it's Effect.

If you don't want to play Ghost Ogre, that's fine though I recommend you to have it because it will be VERY GOOD in like 6 months or something when Grand Creators come to Master Duel. You can use Psychic Wheeleder as an alternative which is only an SR. It's obviously not as good, but you can Special it from hand if you control a Level 3 which Mecha Phantom Beast Tokens are and can pop monsters when used as Synchro Material.

3x Crossout Designator; 2x Called by the Grave; 1x Nibiru, the Primal Being; 1x D.D. Crow; 1x Infinite Impermanence

Crossout and Called by are your Anti-Handtraps while Nibiru, D.D. Crow, and Imperm are just Crossout target while also being a good Handtrap to have. You absolutely HAVE TO STOP your opponent from negating your Halq, or else you pass with like nothing. That's why I have 3 Crossout here. I'm not playing Droll and Ghost Belle because Droll doesn't really stop you from doing your Combo and I haven't really see anyone playing Ghost Belle yet. Nibiru and Imperm are quite common to see in ladder, while D.D. Crow is played by Tri-Brigade. Crossout is also better than Called by when negating a Handtrap that you already have in your hand as Called by negate the monster it banish until the end of NEXT TURN (Pls don't forget that). Additionally, you can also Crossout E-Tele against Virtual World and Crossout a Tenyi for a Mirror match or Swordsoul when BoDE come to Master Duel in 2 months.

Extra Deck

1x Baronne de Fleur; 1x Borreload Savage Dragon; 1x F.A. Dawn Dragster; 1x Herald of the Arc Light

These are your negates. All of them except Dragster can negate anything. Baronne has an extra Effect to pop a card once per turn, and an Effect on Standby Phase that does come up. If Baronne is already out of negate, you can return it to EX in order to revive a Level 9 or lower monster from GY (could be Arc Light, Denglong, Chaofeng, or anything). Borreload is just a big boi with 4050 ATK, and its negate doesn't destroy, so try using it to negate GY Effect or non-continuous Spell/Trap instead of monsters on hand or field. Dragster is an insteresting one, it only negate Spell/Trap and become Level 5 after the negate. You can easily go into Dragster with Destrudo. And lastly, Arc Light, the most hated one. Banishes any monster sent from hand or Main Deck to GY. This will make Tri-Brigade players instantly surrenders and prevent your opponent from using Droplet (they can only send monsters from field which is a huge minus, and if they send no monsters, you can just negate the Droplet). The biggest problem though, is that Arc Light only has 600 ATK and 1000 DEF, can easily get attacked over. However, if Summoned using Bi'an, it completely cover up it's one and only flaws. However, Arc Light also disables your Veiler, Ghost Ogre, and Maxx "C" but not Ash and D.D. Crow.

1x Chaofeng, Phantom of the Yang Zing; 1x Baxia, Brightess of the Yang Zing; 1x Draco Berserker of the Tenyi; 1x Yazi, Evil of the Yang Zing

Chaofeng is a good card when paired with Nine Pillars, it allows you to search ANY Tuner from Deck with no restrictions when destroyed (yes it's a "when" Effect so it can mistiming). This means you can search Ash, Veiler, or Ghost Ogre after negating with Nine Pillars. However, Chaofeng can mistiming, meaning that you HAVE TO use Nine Pillars as cl2 no matter what because popping your Chaofeng has to be last action that happens within that chain (If cl1 is negated, then cl2 is the last action). Not only that, the "then" Effect only happens if the card is shuffled into the Deck. So if you negate a card that sends itself to GY or banish itself as cost (like Fraktall or Koa'ki Meiru Guardian), then you don't get to shuffle it, therefore you don't destroy your Yang Zing. Chaofeng also locks your opponent using the same Attribute as a Yang Zing monster used as material. Chaofeng also has a 3rd Effect (read it yourself).

Next, we have Baxia. Not part of your main Combo but good to have nonetheless. Shuffles cards on field on Summon up to the number of Wyrm monsters used as material with different Attributes. Your tenyi has different Attributes, your Yang Zing too, and Mare Mare is WATER (which is why I play Mapura over Shthana). Baxia can also revive a Level 4 or lower by popping a card you control (can revive Arc Light). Then there's Yazi, whose cannot be targeted by opponent's card. Can pop itself and your opponent's card while also floats into ANY Wyrm from Deck. Yazi is much better going 2nd, because you don't have to use Baronne or Auroradon to pop it and trigger its floating Effect. You can simply use its own Effect

Lastly, we have Draco Berserker, an underatted generic Level 8 Synchro. Draco Berserker can attack twice on monsters and gain a bunch of ATK permanently. It can also banish a monster in response to their Effects (good for something like Raye or Normal Summons). Also it's a Wyrm, so you can Synchro into it after Ashuna Effect.

1x Denglong, First of the Yang Zing; 1x Accel Synchron; 1x Shooting Riser Dragon

These are your Synchro Tuners, which you need because you're Summoning a bunch of non-Tuner Tokens with Auroradon and Mare Mare. Denglong is the Best one, it's a literal +3. Search a Yang Zing card on Summon, send a Wyrm from Deck to GY to change Level, and Floats into a Yang Zing when leaving the field. Also Denglong is Level 5 so Token + O-Lion can make it. Accel Synchron can Send Jet Synchron from Deck to GY to increase or decrease its Level, also it can Quick Synchro on opponent's turn. Shooting Riser can Send any Level 6 or lower monster from Deck to GY on Summon to change Level and it can Quick Synchro on opponent's turn. You don't really Synchro into it at all, it's Simply there for Halq 2nd Effect target. Alternatively, you can play Desert Locust or Formula Synchron, but Shooting Riser is more Versatile.

1x Crystron Halqifibrax; 1x Mecha Phantom Beast Auroradon

Ah yes, who doesn't know about these duo? The Combo that's literally splashable in any Synchro Deck and takes no effort to go into. Halq on Summon can Summon a Level 3 or lower Tuner from Deck and can banish itself on opponent's turn to Special a Synchro Tuner from EX (yes this is treated as a Synchro Summon). Auroradon on Summon can Summon 3 Level 3 Tokens. Can Tribute up to 3 cards to respectively: Pop a card, Special a Mecha Phantom Beast from Deck, and add a Trap from GY.

1x Monk of the Tenyi; 1x Salamangreat Almiraj

You need Monk in order to Special Arboria from hand (if you draw it) and go into Halq. Monk also allows you to go into Halq with 2 Tenyi (including Adhara) without committing into your Normal Summon. And Monk Also enables Vishuda 2nd Effect. Almiraj on the other hand is used for 1 card Halq with Sangan.

Conclusions

The Biggest weakness of the Deck, is that it relies TOO MUCH on Halq and Auroradon, if they're negated, you're absolutely screwed. Which is why I play 2 Called by and 3 Crossout. Unless you go 2nd where you can somewhat Turbo into Yazi into Mare Mare and goes from there. It also lacks follow-up because once again, it relies on Halq and Auroradon. However, it's extremely extremely consistent, 2 monsters is all you need to do some Combos. If you go 2nd, you don't even need Baronne for Full Combo because Yazi can trigger its own Effect by his other Effect. Other than that, Deck can go into Halq without Normal Summon because of how many Extenders it has. This Deck can still play under Maxx "C" simply by passing with 1-2 monsters and relies on your 15 Handtraps (yes that's the exact number of Handtraps I play). That's also the reason why I don't play Equalizer (Board Breakers) like Droplet or Lightning Storm, because if I just prevent my opponent from playing on their first turn, I don't need to negate anything on my turn (still loses to Control Decks lmao). I'm not too worried about Skill Drain because Vishuda can handle that. Overall, I enjoy the Deck a lot. Seeing how Baronne is in the game and I can do Yazi Mare Mare Combo on turn 1 really excites me to make this Combo Deck. The Deck doesn't really have to be expensive, you can swap the staples with other staples that you have or even more Extenders, or just cut the Deck for consistency. I don't recommend crafting 3 Crossout because it may get Semi-Limited, or even Limited in the future (it's Limited on the OCG right now). The next Combo Deck that I will post won't involve HalqDon Combo at all, I promise. I will post it after the Synchro Festival is over

deck_name: Mythical Beast Endymion for Master Duel
deck_excerpt: It’s a good thing the game keeps track of stuff, otherwise I wouldn’t be able to use this deck.
deck_description: I built a Mythical Beast Endymion deck for master duel, this was a lot of resources out of my pocket and even more tweaking as I get something I could use, I’m still adjusting the deck but I decided to post it for you guys to see.  It’s kinda consistent (but can still brick hard) and very good at beating down opponents who overlook effects, which they usually do (people never notice that master Cerberus can’t be destroyed when 4 or more spell counters are on the field)  Once you get the right setup you can start doing some pretty insane combos, I still make misplays like crazy even though I’ve improved sense I started using the deck.  The first objective is getting electrumite out and astrograph into your extra, the setups astrograph  allows in this particular deck can help take you from there, looping astrograph lets you get the maximum amount of spell counters to work with.  Sadly, people always seem to leave mid combo.

deck_name: Red Supernova Resonance (Synchro Festival Compatible) Combos and Tips Included!
deck_excerpt: Bully your opponent with invincible, high ATK dragons and board wipes. Super fun and relatively cheap (low UR CP without Side Deck). The more consiste
deck_description:
If you want to make this deck I highly recommend opening the "Savage Crimson Dragon" secret pack as most of the URs and SRs come from that one pack. It is relatively cheap to make if you exclude the Side Deck.             Literally just switch BLS out for any of the Synchros already in the extra deck or from the side deck if you want to use it in the Synchro Festival. Otherwise BLS can be very situationally useful as it cannot be targeted by card effects (Red Supernova and Red Nova can't be destroyed by card effects but CAN be targeted and thus negated, banished, or returned to hand/deck).        The Main and Extra Deck is what I am currently running/what got me to Plat. The Side Deck is full of staples I think would be beneficial to add if you already have them, they are not necessary for the deck to work properly! Crossout Designator plus Nibiru, the Primal Being are probably the most helpful as the go-to combo often has 5 or more summons. Called by the Grave is also pretty helpful for countering Ash Blossom or Maxx "C."  Hot Red Dragon Archfiend can also be useful in some situations but keep in mind it can't be used to make Red Nova Dragon.  

Strategy

ALWAYS USE CRIMSON RESONATOR'S EFFECT BEFORE SUMMONING ANYTHING ELSE!!       Always go first if able. Ideal end board is solo Red Supernova Dragon (made with Chaos Ruler) with 1 or more Red Reigns/Trap Trick and Solemn Judgement set. This way you have 2 potential board nukes or 1 nuke and an invincible 6000 ATK Monster, plus you don't banish your own monsters and you can bring back Chaos Ruler next turn. THE KEY IS TO WAIT until your opponent is almost finished with their combo OR attempts to banish, negate, or return to hand Supernova Dragon before using Red Reign in order to maximize its effect.        Red Reign is the backbone of this deck and allows it to fairly easily beat Tri Brigade, Sky Striker, Virtual World, etc so long as you go first due to its non-targeting banish and its ability to make Red Supernova Dragon unaffected by card effects (very few decks can hit above 6,000+ ATK and even if they can you can nuke their field with Red Supernova's on attack declaration quick effect). Use it every turn because odds are you will be able to return it to hand. For this reason I want to add Trap Trick to this deck for the frustrating occasions when it isn't in the top 10 cards of the deck.        If you successfully did full first-turn combo (Red Supernova Dragon on the field with Chaos Ruler, 1 Light, and 1 Dark in GY) don't be afraid to use Supernova's effect that banishes it for cost, because you have a guaranteed Chaos Ruler plus whatever combos you still have in hand for the next turn while your opponent has likely used most of their cards.        Nibiru and Ash Blossom are problems, but usually your Nibiru will be more powerful than your opponent's and if you managed to get Chaos Ruler and 1 Light in the GY you can bring him back and continue comboing or go into BLS. Also, usually you can combo through and bait out Ash because of how many search and special summon from hand effects are in this deck. The MAXX "C" challenge has gone 50/50 in my experience.  

Boss Monsters

Red Reign      Legit one of the best trap cards in the whole game when used in this deck. It non-targeting banishes all monsters except those with the highest level, so if you have Lv. 12 Red Supernova Dragon out on the field it's a full nuke. This is the main reason why you want to go first. BUT ITS BEST EFFECT IS THAT IT CAN RECYCLE INFINITELY by adding it to hand from GY when you synchro summon. All Extra Deck monsters but 1 are Dark Dragon Synchro monsters, so this just happens automatically in your combos. Chaos Ruler, The Chaotic Magical Dragon synergizes with this card perfectly, as it gives you 5 extra chances at "drawing" Red Reign. Also, Chaos Ruler's GY effect means you can pretty much always synchro summon again on your Second Turn.      Furthermore, it makes your Red Supernova Dragon into a nearly impenetrable wall of ATK by making it unaffected by your opponent's card effects for 1 turn. If you use this card at the right time, it can easily guarantee a win. Lets also not miss the fact that this card's board nuke effect IS NOT LIMITED TO ONE USE PER TURN. So if you have 1 Red Reign in hand and 1 gets sent to the GY by Chaos Ruler during the combo, you have 2 board nukes and the ability to chain the invincibility effect if your opponent can react to the first. For this reason I want to add Trap Trick to further increase consistency.    Red Supernova Dragon      Go-to boss monster. On average 6,000 ATK when summoned on first turn. Can't be destroyed by card effects, but CAN BE TARGETED > use Red Reign to make up for this weakness. On monster effect or attack declaration it can BANISH ALL CARDS YOUR OPPONENT CONTROLS, yes that means spells and traps too! (it also comes back to your field at the end of your nest End Phase). Wish it had an animation though.   Red Nova Dragon      Worse version of Red Supernova Dragon, but still an absolute beatstick. No board nuke quick effect, but still unable to be destroyed by card effect (can still be targeted though). MAIN THING TO REMEMBER is that to make Red Nova you HAVE TO USE Red Dragon Archfiend or Scarlight Red Dragon Archfiend.   Hot Red Dragon Archfiend King Calamity      Low-Key has the most OP effect in the entire game > STOPS YOUR OPPONENT FROM ACTIVATING ALL CARD EFEFCTS FOR ONE TURN! This absolutely destroys Dragonmaids and other decks with lots of Battle Phase or On Attack effects, as well as trap heavy decks that get too greedy and wait for your boss monster to come out (your opponent cannot react to this effect with card effects).   Tyrant Red Dragon Archfiend      Newest addition to the deck, still in testing phase. Adds another nuke and negate to the deck. Nuff said   Hot Red Dragon Archfiend Bane      Usually only used on your second turn or later. Can sacrifice another monster on the field to bring back another "Red Dragon Archfiend." Often you will use one of the free, special summon from hand or GY monsters to do this (Synkron, Creation, Wandering King, Chaos Ruler). This also works well with its ability to summon 2 tuners (1 from deck and 1 from GY) after doing damage.   Hot Red Dragon Archfiend Abyss      Go-to negate for the deck, works on all card effects used ON THE FIELD (can't negate GY or hand effects). Works pretty well as a replacement for Red Supernova Dragon if you brick and can't summon it SO LONG AS YOU HAVE RED REIGN. Summons a tuner from your GY after if does damage > this often means you can get some extra combos in Main Phase 2. Synchro summoning this monster is an easy way to get Red Reign back on your Second Turn as there are 7 Lv. 1 tuners in the deck and if you got the proper First Turn combo you should be able to get Chaos Ruler back from the GY.   Chaos Ruler, The Chaotic Magical Dragon      Main Lv. 8 Synchro Dark Dragon you will be using for combo purposes. Its ability to come back from the GY by banishing 1 Dark and 1 Light monster from the GY makes it great synchro fodder and bait for negates. Its on-summon excavate ability is doubly useful as it can provide extra combos and get a Red Reign in the GY (which will be returned to hand when you use Chaos Ruler to synchro another Dark Dragon). The real MVP of the deck.   Scarlight Red Dragon Archfiend      Just a better version of Red Dragon Archfiend. Go-to when making Red Nova Dragon. Its effect to destroy all special summoned monsters with less or equal ATK can be very useful, and you can always use it as synchro fodder after activating this effect.   Beelze of the Diabolic Dragons    Good defensive wall if you happen to brick and can only get out a Lv. 8. It can also become a pretty strong beatstick in certain situations and punishes opponents for using burn strategies that don't OTK.   Red Dragon Archfiend      Classic, but kinda trash. Its ability to destroy all Defense Position monsters can be situationally useful, but its secondary effect can backfire significantly and precludes any Main Phase 2 combos. Still useful for making Red Nova Dragon though.    Red Rising Dragon      Basically an anti-brick measure by making Wandering King more useful in-hand. Can make Red Supernova Dragon if you also have Crimson Resonator (just pick 2 Lv.2's instead of 2 Lv.1's). Can also use it to get a massive Life Point boost by bringing back Red Resonator and targeting your 6,000+ ATK Red Supernova Dragon.   Black Luster Soldier - Soldier of Chaos      Situationally very useful due to the fact it cant be targeted by card effects (this covers the weakness of Red Supernova and Red Nova). You won't always be able to summon it though because some of the combo cards limit you to Synchro or Dark Dragon monsters only for 1 turn.    

Combo Cards

Synkron Resonator      Great for making Hot Red Dragon Archfiend Abyss or as fodder for Hot Red Dragon Archfiend's effect. Second effect is great for letting you set up Second Turn combos based on what you have in-hand.   Chain Resonator      EXTREMELY IMPORTANT CARD! The 2 copies of this card are the ONLY 2 Light monsters in this deck, which you need for Chaos Ruler, The Chaotic Magical Dragon's effect. THEREFORE, YOU NEED AS MANY COPIES OF THIS CARD AS YOU HAVE OF CHAOS RULER! Its normal summon effect can be very helpful for many Second Turn combos, and being Lv. 1 it can make Hot Red Dragon Archfiend Abyss.    Psi-Reflector      1-Card combo. Usually select Assault Beast the first time you use its summon effect (just read combos) but once the combo is set up, select Assault Sentinel because it basically guarantees you can special summon Psi-Reflector next turn.   Red Resonator      Great backup combo starter. Even better backup secondary effect (on special summon it lets you gain Life Points based on the ATK of a monster on the field, yes even your 6,000+ ATK Red Supernova Dragon) for emergency situations. Often a good idea to use its normal summon effect with Assault Sentinel, because you can make a Lv. 10 that way.   Crimson Resonator      ALWAYS USE THIS CARD'S IN HAND EFFECT BEFORE SUMMONING ANYTHING! It is often a good idea to try to bait out Ash Blossom by using Resonator Call even if you already have Crimson in hand, because if they ash Crimson's second effect rather than Chaos Ruler's effect then you can't make Red Supernova Dragon. It can be a good idea to return it to hand with Synkron Resonator's effect just in case your board gets cleared because you can then use its full effect on your Second Turn.   Wandering King Wildwind      Its GY effect makes great bait for Ash Blossoms or other negates if you already have a combo in hand. Otherwise, it can help you get the card you need. For this reason I often don't select it with Chaos Ruler's effect unless I specifically need it for a combo because then it ends up in the GY. Like all special summon from-hand cards in this deck, makes great fodder for Hot Red Dragon Archfiend Bane's effect.   Ascator, Dawnwalker      The backup Lv. 8 synchro option because of its discard cost. It really hurts when this card gets Ash Blossomed so I usually try to use another card first. IF EVER POSSIBLE, DISCARD RED REIGN! You will bring it back to your hand immediately after you use Ascator to synchro summon. A second-best option is Fire Ant Ascator because it is useless in hand.   Resonator Call      Great bait for negates, people seem to have a deep fear of searchers. Usually used to get Crimson Resonator in hand.    Emergency Teleport      Another great bait option if you have more combos in hand. Great because it saves you normal summoning Psi-Reflector or Assault Sentinel.    

Combos

Main 1st turn combo (if you start with Crimson Resonator or Resonator Call): (You can always risk it if you have Ascator, Dawnwalker and hope that Chaos Ruler excavates Crimson Resonator --> you need your normal summon for Crimson Resonator this way)      Use Crimson Resonator's effect to Special Summon itself  > Use one of the combos below to get out Chaos Ruler, The Chaotic Magical Dragon and activate effect > Pray a Red Reign gets sent to the GY if you didn't start with one, and add to hand whatever you can that helps you best  > Activate Crimson Resonator and summon Chain Resonator and Synkron Resonator > Make Red Supernova Dragon > Activate Synkron Resonator and add Crimson Resonator or Psi-Reflector to hand > Activate Red Reign's effect in GY and add it to hand > Set Red Reign and Solemn Judgement/Trap Trick > End Turn   Combos to get out Chaos Ruler or Other Lv.8 Synchro (based on cards in hand): Psi-Reflector:       Normal Summon Psi-Reflector > Activate effect > Add Assault Beast to hand > Activate Assault Beast and add Assault Mode Activate to hand > Activate Psi-Reflector, targeting Assault Beast > Increase level by 3 > Make Chaos Ruler, The Magical Dragon   Assault Sentinel:      Normal summon Assault Sentinel > Activate effect, tribute to special summon Psi-Reflector > Follow the steps for Psi-Reflector.    Ascator, Dawnwalker:      Activate Ascator, Dawnwalker > Discard least useful card (usually Creation Resonator, Red Resonator, or Wandering King) > Activate second effect and summon Fire Ant Ascator > Make Chaos Ruler   Wandering King Wildwind and a Lv.2 Tuner:      If Crimson Resonator: Activate Crimson Resonator to special summon it > Activate Wandering King Wildwind to special summon it > Make Red Rising Dragon > Activate Red Rising Dragon, targeting Crimson Resonator > Make Chaos Ruler -OR- Activate Crimson Resonator, selecting 2 Lv.2 tuners > Make Red Supernova Dragon        If Red Resonator: Normal summon Red Resonator > Activate Red Resonator, selecting Chain Resonator or Assault Sentinel (if in hand, otherwise you can just select Wandering King or Synkron Resonator even though it is redundant) > Activate Wandering King Wildwind to special summon it > Make Red Rising Dragon > Activate Red Rising Dragon, targeting Red Resonator > Activate Red Resonator, targeting monster with highest ATK > Make Chaos Ruler -Then if able- Use Chain Resonator and make Hot Red Dragon Archfiend Abyss -OR-  Activate Assault Sentinel and follow the steps for Assault Sentinel above but make Scarlight Red Dragon Archfiend instead -OR- Activate Synkron Resonator to special summon it > Make Hot Red Dragon Archfiend Abyss    

Second Turn Combos/Strategy

If You Successfully did Full Combo (Supernova made with Chaos Ruler) Based on Board and Cards in Hand Red Supernova Dragon on Board:      At this point you've pretty much won. If you used Red Reign at the right time and your opponent has no monsters you have lethal, just activate Chaos Ruler, The Chaotic Magical Dragon's GY effect by banishing Barrier Resonator and 1 Dark monster and you have on average 8,000 ATK.   Empty Board with Crimson Resonator in hand (E.g. You used Supernova's effect or it got banished/returned to deck) (You can try to set this up on your first turn by returning Crimson Resonator to hand with Synkron Resonator when you make Supernova)      Activate Crimson Resonator, special summon from hand > Activate Chaos Ruler, the Chaotic Magical Dragon's GY effect, banish Barrier Resonator and the least useful Dark (usually Psi-Reflector) to special summon it > Activate Crimson Resonator, selecting tuners based on desired Synchro and what combos with what you have in hand -THEN- use whatever combo is in your hand and utilize the extra tuners from Crimson Resonator (you can only use properly with an empty board   Other Second Turn Combos to Come Shortly

deck_excerpt: As you can see this deck it's a mashup of random stuff that somehow works (I use it for Master Duel's N/R Format) The main objective is using Dangers
deck_description: As you can see this deck it's a mashup of random stuff that somehow works (I use it for Master Duel's N/R Format) The main objective is using Dangers to discard Dangers, Dark Worlds, and Fables to do great effects. I put some chaos cards 'cause sinergices with The Fables, Ojama, and Cyber Dragons being Light monster and Dangers, Dark Worlds, and Chaos monsters being Dark Monsters. Ojama can be useful 'cause of it's effect of when being sent to the grave while being in the field or hand to both players drawing 1 card and discarding one card.  I put in Paleos for two reasons one Dinomischus it's a great card and 'cause of the Discard effect and two They can be used as Link/Tribute fodder. So something you should take into account when playing this deck it's Dark World's rulings. So just to summarize Dark World only activate their effect when they are discarded BY AN EFFECT, if it's discarded by COST they would not trigger. Don't worry Fables and Dangers trigger even as Discard cost.  Ok so just to help anyone using Dark Worlds. I'll clarify which ones are cost and which ones are effect. COST (Dark worlds WON'T trigger): Lighting Vortex and Phoenix Wind Wing Blast. They're more cards that count as Cost, but these are the ones in this decks. EFFECT (Dark worlds will trigger): Dangers, Bone Temple Block, Danger! Zone, Fabled Treason, Fabled Raven, and Paleozoic Dinomischus.  If you wish you could use this Decklist as a basis for your future decks.

deck_excerpt: They say koh the face stealer in ATLA has nothing on relinquished the body stealer
deck_description: Check out my deck build video here: https://youtu.be/dpLMPdn8Bzc The objective of this deck is to steal  your opponent's monsters to powerup your own monsters and go for the win. You can do that by ritual summoning Relinquished and using its effect to steal a monster, Fusion summoning either of the restrict monsters, using your hand trap (Millenium-Eyes Illusionist), The effect of Golden-Eyes Idol once discarded or banish, and more!!!

An unexpected combination that somehow works. This deck is by no means meta, but I find it very enjoyable to play. When making the deck I thought "I really like the esthetic of the Egyptian God cards and Exodia. What if I combined Obelisk the Tormentor and The Legendary Exodia Incarnate?" and after testing the deck a bunch and finding what does and doesn't work I've come up with this decklist! To me decks like this encapsulate what Yugioh is about which is: Having fun, trying new things and just being creative. It's not all about making the most competitive meta deck and winning all the time because it gets stale and boring using the same cards over and over, especially if everyone else is using them too. No hate to the people who do enjoy playing like that but personally it's not for me.

deck_excerpt: A casual Herald deck built without utilizing Drytron, Cyber Angels, or any other archetypes.
deck_description:
A deck built around the Heralds without help from other archetypes. I find the Heralds pretty cool. But personally, the usage of Herald of Ultimateness in some Drytron decks never suited my tastes with them. And, as a very non-meta casual player, I wanted to create a less powerful deck built around them. This deck uses Herald of Perfection rather than Herald of Ultimateness for consistency; as it is easier to bring out Herald of Perfection.

Description and Strategies

The main gimmick is using Herald of Perfection to negate plays by your opponent by sending Fairies from your hand to the Graveyard. And as such, this deck's monsters are almost exclusively Fairies. Eva, being a notable example, allows you to add 2 more Fairies to your hand when sent to the Graveyard. While the Heralds are good at shutting your opponent down, they have a considerable lack of offensive ability. Which is where Saffira, Queen of Dragons, Honest, and Hip Hoshiningen come in. Saffira is a great help for more than offensive ability as she gets to add cards to your hand at the end of turns where a LIGHT monster was sent from your hand to the Graveyard. Which should be happening frequently due to the Herald's negation cost. Saffira's effect can benefit in many different ways within the deck. She can be used to recycle Eva and Honest. She can allow you to draw more cards to get what you want. Or you can cripple your opponent by discarding a card from their hand. Additionally, her ritual spell "Hymn of Light" works as Ritual Monster destruction protection. As if it is in the Graveyard, you can banish it instead of letting a ritual monster be destroyed. This is great if your opponent is able to beat over Herald of Perfection without activating effects which you can negate. Hymn of Light can also be discarded by Saffira's draw 2 effect, or can be set on the field in hopes your opponent destroys it. As long as it's in the Graveyard, it works. Don't underestimate the Non-Ritual Heralds either. They can be great hand-traps if you don't have Herald of Perfection on the field yet. This deck runs 3 copies of Herald of Orange Light, 2 of Green Light, and 1 of Purple Light. They can be used as fodder for Herald of Perfection. Or, they can negate your opponents effects according to their corresponding card types (Orange = Monster, Green = Spell, Purple = Trap). Orange Light is especially helpful as monster effects are typically the most important to shut down. And it also protects you from your opponent's hand traps, like Ash Blossom. Do note that using these three as hand traps has a heavy discard cost. So be careful with what you choose to negate.   Some Knightmares are in the Extra Deck to compensate for the deck's lack of removal. Just in case you end up facing a field you cant deal with. And Salamangreat Almiraj to be able to send Eva to the Graveyard after normal summoning it (slight brick protection).

Weaknesses

Of course, this deck is not without its weaknesses. Early on, it's easy to be denied access to Herald of Perfection. Additionally, Herald of Perfection has low ATK, so putting it in Attack Position is risky. Also noteworthy, Herald of Perfection cannot negate Counter-Traps. A well-timed Counter-Trap can easily get rid of Herald of Perfection. Continuous Traps/Spells also can't be negated after they are first activated. Effects that don't warrant an actual activation (cards that special summon themselves, for instance) also can't be negated. And finally, Herald of Perfection's negation cost is a discard. So you will typically be low on card advantage. Meaning, if your board is broken, it may be hard to build it up again.

Side Deck

  • Herald of Ultimateness and it's Ritual Spell is in the Side Deck in case it's wanted to be played.
  • A Timelord is in the Side Deck so Diviner of Herald can gain its level to summon Ultimateness. This can be replaced with any Level 10 Fairy-type Extra Deck Monster.
  • 3 of the Non-Ritual Main Deck Heralds are in the Side Deck so TCG format can be played by replacing Eva with them.
  • Some draw power through Pot of Extravagance is in there as well. As it may be needed if you need more cards in your hand.
It should be noted, the Side Deck for this deck isn't a proper Side Deck. It adds more options but not much else. I would recommend filling the Side Deck with cards that counter certain decks.

deck_excerpt: Standard Floowandereeze build, 2 Empen 1 City Of Dreams
deck_description: Pretty standard build, you can main 2x book of moon and side dark ruler no more (preference imho). So far this is my fav build, if ur against eldlich just main simorgh and its gg's, you can change nibiru with smt like ra sphere mode or kaiju's i like nibiru atm. Best possible combo is Robina + Eaglen to Empen into chain journey preparation on Empen, then Stri + Toccan to redo Empen(not once x turn effect) and you get empen windbarrier and both the trap and the cont spell on the field.  I rarely use the extra deck but sometimes Lyrillusc into Zeus is useful.

Eldlich control deck first 7/8 turns, after 8 turns (or when you banish all the eldlich engine) extradeck comes in helpful to close the game. Evenly Matched is really good in mirror matchups, you can use LavaGolem or Ra Sphere mode instead of Nibiru (atm i pref nibiru imho). Handtraps are good but i think the deck does not need them straight away.

The deck is kinda tricky to master, best possible board is to setup Argonaut, Toadally Awesome and the handtrap with field spell. The deck is full of extenders and combo makers, pretty much you just need 1 Blue Tang and ur set for the full combo, send SeaHorse to gy link into BlueSlug and so on to build your board by getting Marincess Dive to hand (that card is broken af), if ur in trouble you can go with splash mage and re-generate the board, keep in mind, before going for the link 4's you should first add the handtrap with Coral Triangle otherwise the board is too weak. You should definitely go for White Howling in going second games, that card is nuts. Be careful with ur extradeck don't waste it all 1st turn just to show-off use it wisely. P.S. Stealth Kragen can be really useful in tricky situations.

deck_excerpt: Eldlich control with Dogmatika and Dpe
deck_description: Basic Eldich engine + dpe package + punishment. The deck is pretty much a pure control/stall deck, once you burn the eldlich engine you can choose to go for extradeck plays with dpe or clearing the board with punishment. Solemn judgment is pretty good almost only going 1st so i'd rather side deck it. Evenly matched is useful in mirror matchups. You can change Nibiru with LavaGolem or Ra Sphere mode if you prefere (i pref nib more atm). Handtraps are good (you can go for 50/60 cards deck using ashblossom, psy-frame gamma ecc. but then you kinda have a complete stall style deck).

deck_excerpt: A test deck based around the Suship archtype. Its a starting point not a finished deck. Improvements can be made by removing the utility cards and ins
deck_description: The strategy of this deck is to use the gunkan monsters to get to the xyz Gunkan Suships fast. Other monsters in the deck are used more as utility cards

Pretty nuts deck with the new cards, you have an insane amount of possibilites, you can make Albion into Dragoon, you can go for guardian chimera + branded in red, you can go for double masquerade ecc. On top of all you have dpe packange and adventurer package to setup more negates on board. Don't underestimate the new trap and the field spell they are both nuts. I don't really like Dramaturge tbh, i think it can make the deck a bit unstable, so i'd rather side deck it. Link spider can be really useful in this build and can help to go for anaconda in a lot of bad hands situations where you can't just use branded fusion straight away.

deck_excerpt: A deck with just 1 Aluber. Cheaper alternative. There arent a lot of expensive cards except Aluber and Chimere. Half of the deck is from (3) Structure
deck_description: Start with Branded Fusion to summon Albion Branded Following Mirrorjade. You get it with Springans Kitt or Aluber. Get Aluber with Branded Opening or Tragedy. Send Tragedy to gy by Burial Sakrophag, Allure or a fusion.  With Branded Lost get Springans Kitt or Mercourier if you need.  If you activate Mirrorjade send Sprind to gy to get a antother Springans for turn 2 or Brigrand to get Mercourier.  With Mirrorjade on field next to summon is Lubellion (Albaz and Dramaturg with Branded Fusion) following Dragostapelia for some negation and dont forget Dramaturg.     For example a good field looks like Branded Lost and Theater, Mirrorjade Dragostapelia Quaeritis.  Without Chimere you dont need Poly, Mudragon and antoher Albaz should be fine.  As you can see handtraps and Sidedeck are a cheaper version. I want to try out some locales with this deck, if you have some suggestions please leave a comment.

deck_excerpt: Floowandereeze. No Special Summoning. Normal Summon forever.
deck_description: So i finally return with a more updated build of my previous Floowandereeze Dogmatika build.  A fair bit has changed since the previous format, but i will included a brief outline of the decks key themes as well as my changes.  The ratio of 2 Empen, 1 Raiza and 1 Apex I believe is still correct. 2 Empen is great when you need to stop decks reliant on their link monster effects to be able to play (Prank Kids, PK, Tri-Brigade and Striker), and always being able to search a second is always handy in case they are able to get through both statue and the first copy for special summon decks in general. 1 Raiza is enough with careful management to loop itself and your opponents cards back, especially if you have Unexplored Winds up. 1 Apex is a looping negate which makes the deck really strong.  The Dogmatika package has lost 1 copy of Nadir to the banlist, and 1 of the 2 copies of Punishment in my previous build, mainly as the Floowandereeze engine has much more consistency now and i require a backup plan less of the time.  The main deck does not feature Shifter or and handtraps because the deck has plently of board breaker/force negate options thanks to Nadir, Book Of Moon, Raigeki, Harpie's Feather Duster and dare i say it Mystic Mine. Shifter conflicts with the Dogmatika engine as well as being useless in an ever increasing number of mirror matches. Book Of Moon acts to prevent veiler/imperm negating vital Floowandereeze plays as well as trading off negates going second. Nadir is useful for baiting Ash as well as proving an option for Empen to normal summon Ecclessia in case you cannot get Barrier Statue out (or game 2/3 versus the mirror). Raigeki, Harpies and Mine also force negation or break boards. Being able to get rid of Mine naturally makes it great to stall until you have the resources you need.  A lone copy of Judgement in the main deck is there to prevent Droplets/DRNM/Raigeki/Lightning Storm from stopping Empen/Statute  Nothing has changed in the ED. Everything is very Dogmatika related bar Assembled Nightingale + Zeus package. Verdant is there on rare occasions to summon Baronne and posdibly opposing Apex/Raiza.  Side deck choices are simple. Dark Simorgh for Eldlich and other backrow heavy decks. D-Shifter VS everything except the mirror. Night Beam is my interesting tech choice. Being able to pick of set Dreaming Town in the mirror can really be useful, but can used against Sanguine in Eldlich  as well. Twin Twisters would result in discarding cards which isn't always the best option and Cyclone allows the likes of Dreaming Town to be recovered more easily with Toucan, being sent to grave means it has to banish itself via it's second effect or be banished by Stri. Also cards like Sanguine can simply be activated in response to it.  An additonal copy of Raigeki and Mystic Mine for combo/monster heavy decks, Triple Evenly for the mirror and any deck after you bait negations, 2 more Solemn for going 1st after siding and Macro Cosmos for a permanent D-Shifter.

deck_excerpt: May 2022 is gonna be "fun" for fusion decks. Especially for this one :)
deck_description: Video link in the description below ( https://youtube.com/watch?v=rWbMx7KpfJQ&t ) What is Hell? Hell can be many things: from cutting your finger off a blender, to accidentally breaking your own board with one card you want to break on your opponent. Although most of us don't like it nor we deny it's existence, it is the external force that keeps spiritual balance to our world and beyond. The reality is however is that we are doing a terrible job at it, and that is why we are living in nothing but degeneracy and moral decay. Despia is what is exactly from a stand point of anything being hell on earth; but the fact is deck I am using today won't be using Predaplant Verte Anaconda or be running a fully functional Adventurer engine. This is in part due to the upcoming banlist making them the two hot spots for either bannings or limitations. So as with any Despia deck: you go with 3 Aluber, 2 Tragedy, 1 Ad Libitum, and 1 Comedy; but with the release of Branded Fusion, you can continue going with 2 Fallen of Albaz without concerns of Polymerization or that one Despia field spell that did things. Also besides Branded Fusion, another change I made to Branded - Despia is the addition of Pot of Prosperity (a card that seen play for quite a while now) and the new card Branded Exile (A card that Special Summons a "Despia" or Level 8 or higher Fusion Monster, then goes into a fusion summon by banishing from either field). The extra deck also hasn't had any real significant changes from any other Despia - Albaz deck besides the newly released monsters from the Albaz Strike Structure Deck and with three link monsters, with whom (besides Dharc the Dark Charmer, Gloomy because he makes use of your opponents Dark monsters from the GY) have no significance besides fusion fodder and I'm ok with that.

deck_excerpt: A deck built around the Spider archetype. A weak archetype focused on putting your opponent in face-up defense position and gaining advantage off of i
deck_description:
Description and Strategies

The main gimmick of Spiders, is putting your opponent's monsters into face-up Defense Position, and gaining advantage off of that. The deck doesn't synergise perfectly with itself, so strategies must be used to cater to each card individually:
  • Mother Spider works as long as your opponent has 2 face-up Defense Position monsters. As she simply tributes them to Special Summon herself. Cards like Earthquake and Spider's Web greatly improve this. As they can force your opponent into Defense Position on a larger scale. It's best to use this to tribute stronger monsters your opponent controls.
  • Spyder Spider works rather simply. If it destroys a Defense Position monster (face-up or face-down) you get to Special Summon a Level 4 or lower Insect from your Graveyard. This can be used to Special Summon most cards in this deck.
  • Informer Spider must be destroyed by a card effect to activate it's effect. Which is to take control over a defense position monster your opponent controls. The easiest way to do this is to use Shield Crush on your own set Informer Spider.
  • Ground Spider has a soft Once Per Turn effect to set an opponent's summoned monster to Defense Position. However, this is only available if Ground Spider itself is in Defense Position. Earthquake can help with this. Additionally, attacking with Ground Spider into anything that wont destroy it while Spider's Web is active will also put Ground Spider into Defense Position without requiring you to wait a turn with it in Attack Position. Spyder Spider and Dragonbite are also capable of Special Summoning Ground Spider in face-up Defense Position.
  • Relinquished Spider can be utilized well in the later game. Use any established method to get your opponent's monsters in face-up Defense Position. Then you can summon Relinquished Spider (normal or special). It's effect allows you to tribute it as a cost, in order to destroy all face-up Defense Position monsters your opponent controls.
Dark Spider, even though it is technically a part of the archetype, does nothing to support it. And can't be used effectively. So it wasn't included. Underground Arachnid, is technically a part of the archetype as well. But it's barely used because it's hard to bring out in a Spider deck. Dragonbite is a Level 4 Dark Tuner, so summoning it with Relinquished Spider will allow you to summon it. Some other noteworthy cards in the deck, that haven't been mentioned yet are:
  • Verdant Sanctuary, which allows you to add another Insect of the same level to your hand when an Insect is destroyed. This is helpful since most of the deck is consistently leveled.
  • Retaliating "C" and Resonance Insect, which both work as searchers for the other cards. Retaliating "C" searches every Insect in the deck (except Mother Spider). And Resonance Insect searches Mother Spider.
  • Spider's Lair, which isn't too helpful if Spider's Web is already active, but can work as a good alternative.
  • Enemy Controller, which both allows you to put a monster in face-up Defense Position, and allows you to tribute one of your monsters, to take control of an opponents. Which you can then tribute if you are capable. Note that you can actually use Enemy Controller more than once per turn. So you can Tribute a monster to take control of an opponents monster. Then Tribute that monster to take control of another monster. Which you can then tribute for Mother Spider or a Link Summon.
  • Butterflyoke, which in a way, locks your opponent's monster in whatever position you want them in. Though, it does require that monster to attack first.
  • Number 70: Malevolent Sin, which doesn't synergize with the deck other than being a Level 4 XYZ monster. But, it does have the appearance of a spider, and it's always good to have. As it can gain high ATK, and can get some pesky monsters out of the way for the turn.
  • Inzektor Picofalena, which can be used to equip Resonance Insect or Retaliating "C" onto another monster you control. Then you can get rid of the equipped monster, and activate their effects.
  • Insect Shinobi Hagakuremino, which allows you to Special Summon an Insect Monster when a card it points to is destroyed. It's just generally helpful for the deck. Especially with Inzektor Picofalena.
  • Seraphim Papillion also allows you to Special Summon Insects from your Graveyard. and works with Inzektor Picofalena as well.

 Weaknesses

Spiders have a lot of weaknesses. They have low stats, so it's easy to simply get beaten over if you don't have the proper defenses. The deck is generally inconsistent as well. As it requires multiple cards in your hand to do anything. Their biggest weakness however, is Link Monsters. As Link Monsters can't be in Defense Position. Thus being immune to all of the Spider's effects.

Side Deck

  • Galaxy Cyclone and Mystical Space Typhoon are for basic spell removal. In case of any sort of floodgate, or any other devastating trap/spell.
  • Mirror Force and Storming Mirror Force are mainly there to help deal with Link Monsters. As they can only be in Attack Position.
  • Dark Mirror Force is a fun addition in general. If you could only put some of their monsters in defense position, and they try to attack.

deck_excerpt: This is an attempt at making a Zefra combo deck that has a flexible playing style.
deck_description: This is an attempt at making a Zefra combo deck that has a flexible playing style. Hand traps, as well as Destrudo, are meant to enable synchro plays with Odd-Eyes and level 9 synchros. The Zefra archetype cards are present to provide access to trap cards on short notice. Strategy is somewhat solid but deck composition is unrefined.  The first linked video shows the test hand replays made using this deck. The second linked video shows the exact deck list that is shown here but it also goes into the reasoning as to why each set of cards is played. The third linked video shows six different replays in which I describe the events of each duel through each play, at least for the most part. Furthermore, the third video shows the deck list and the immediate changes that I would make to it based on its displayed performance, as well as explanations for said changes.  Test Hands  https://youtu.be/p0IdQDVKzCM  Deck Profile  https://youtu.be/BWWS0P8Fb3k  Replays and Review  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vOqzd1z9vPE

deck_excerpt: Magikey based on the Old Dino-Rabbit Engine works great for making Halquifibrax plays
deck_description: The deck is a typical Auroradon combo that gets started with normal monsters. Unexpected Dai, Tour Guide of the Underworld, Rescue Rabbit, Emergency Teleport. All get you the Tuner on field you need in order to get Halq out. Genex controller is a backup machine type monster in deck in the event you end up using 001 + Dai/E-Tele for your Tuner+1 into Halq. Kaiju's, Sphere Mode, and Nibiru serve the role to remove on-field threats either en-mass or strategically, specifically the wind and water kaiju's for Low Atk and dealing with Wind Barrier Statue.  The primary combo would seek to utilize Magikey Mechmusket - Batobuster as a major search engine. Ideally you would start with 1 in hand but if not there are methods to pull it out. A combo line that you would seek would be summoning Halq any way possible, pulling out 001 to link into Auroradon. This would pull out 3 tokens + 001 from the grave off of its own effect. Synchro for 4 into Herald of Arc light then use Auroradon to tribute Herald and a token to pull out Coltwing. This would give you 2 more tokens as well as either Batobuster or Advanced Ritual Art in order to summon one you may already have in your hand. This would then allow you to summon it allowing you to add Magikey World to your hand. This field spell is drastically overpowered not only adding you a Magikey Monster to your hand but more importantly allowing you to add the Fusion/Ritual spell as well as returning a Garnet back to your deck. At this stage you would want to add Magneficent Magikey Mafteal to your hand and trigger its effect for a 2nd normal summon. You do not have to normal summon it immediately at this point and it is recommended you don't. Using the 2nd effect of the Field spell allows you to add the Fusion/Ritual spell to your hand which enables Fusion/Ritual Summon from Deck while you control a normal monster, tokens included. This allows you to send any normal monster + 1 Magikey monster to Special Summon Magikey Beast Ansyalabolas, recycling your Ritual/Fusion spell. At this point you should have pulled out 001 off of Coltwing allowing you to Synchro for 7 for either Clear Wing Fast Dragon or F.A. Dawn Dragster (thank god the Mecha Phantom Beast Tokens are wind). You need to keep the token on field in order to trigger the "Send from Deck" effect of Magikey Mafeta. Fusing first then ritual summoning the 2nd time after recycling the spell would enable 2 level 4 tuners on the field at the same time as your Level 3 token and Level 7 Coltwing. You can Synchro for 7 first for Fast/Dawn (whichever one you didn't get first)  in order to drop Coltwings Level back to 4 in order to Synchro for 8. Savage if you own it or Dragite if you don't own a Savage. Halq serves as the water type for Dragrite if you are worried. This would give you Fast + Dragster + Savage/Dragite while having the triggered Magineficent Magikey in Hand. At this point Normal summon it and use its effect to special summon a non-tuner Magikey Monster for the Level 8 Synchro Transfurlmine. Transfurlmine allows you to set a magikey Spell/Trap from deck as well as a HOPT trap hole, it is recommended to set the Spell/Trap Magikey Counter Trap in order to not be nuked by Dark Ruler No More. This field should enable 1 Omni-Negate from Savage or a S/T Negate from Dragite, 1 S/T negate via Dragster, 1 Extra Deck monster negate via Fast, a Trap Hole from Transfurmine, and a counter trap negate from Magikey Unlocking. After that fill the deck with your favorite Fuse from deck monster that can use Normal-Monsters as fusion material such as Rainbow Neos, or Dragoon. Unfortunately there are no Normal Destiny Hero monsters for DPE and the Extra deck would be too cramped for it anyway. Alternate strategies include buffing the Hell out of Mechmoarter for a Monster effect negate thanks to its Atk gaining bonus.  Weaknesses include droplet, Dark ruler no more, generally any "cannot respond" cards.  P.S. It is possible in a severely desperate state to use the pendulum effects of Hallo Hallo and Magicalibra to increase the level of Dawn Dragster to extremes, buff its attack and pierce for game.

deck_excerpt: How to win sometimes with Valkyries.
deck_description: So basically you saw the OG yugioh Anime, loved how cool the Valkyrie Archetype was and found out they were printed in the past few years and want to run it. This is how you win with them without cheating like Zigfried did. The win condition of the deck is resolving grass to get all combo pieces to Two(?) Turn Kill unprepared players which when it comes to meta decks is pretty much nobody. Most of the deck is tailored for that purpose and to improve consistency, you want to have Final Light or Ride of the Valkyries resolve to summon a few Valkyries to the board and get a second battlephase thanks to Mischief of the Time Goddess's unique effect. Goddess Urd's veredict protects your Valkyries while Jet Synchron and Halquifibrax are two very busted cards that net you some backup plays as well as more draw power thanks to a few busted Synchro monsters and will improve consistency, give you acceptable turn 1 boards with an Omni Negate, let you maybe survive another turn or even pick up wins against some weaker decks thanks to how busted Borreload Savage Dragon and Auroradon are. Once you have picked up on the deck's main strategies it's almost as brainless as Numeron OTK, just more RNGish and harder to get enough firepower on the field to OTK. Remember how in the Anime they only played with 4000 LP? Yeah... A few things to keep in mind: Ride of the Valkyries while good, will shuffle back ALL monsters on your field back into the deck at the end of the turn, yes, including that Borreload you just made. UNLESS you have triggered Mischief of the time goddess in the same turn, except Mischief won't work if you have any monster that's not a Valkyrie on the field. So forget about comboing into Borreload to get more ATK on the board for the kill outside of the one in a thousand chance you got 2-3 high Level Valkyries + Borreload + Auroradon up and the opponent is pretty much wide open. That said because Mischief of the Time Goddess lets you bypass Ride of the Valkyries's second effect you're free to combo into Borreload to end your turn, so don't get hasty with that Jet Synchron/Plaguespreader Zombie effect in your GY. Playing smart will win you more duels. Staples/Handtraps depend on meta/preference as well as Banlist availability. This whole deck is crippled if Grass gets banned/limited/negated so keep that in mind. Crossout Designator is maybe a card one should run at 3 depending on how many handtraps you use. In general you don't want to be running too many non normal spells/traps because you can use Valkyrie Vierte's effect to mill a few cards and maybe get one of Grass/Mallet/Ride of the Valkyries/Final Light onto your hand for a quite big consistency boost. As a rule of thumb, if you haven't won by turn 4 or at worst turn 6 you lost. If you bricked you lost. If the opponent is a decent player running a half decent deck you lost. Yeah, Valkyries are just not good on modern Yugioh and the only reason this kinda works is Grass is one of the most broken cards in the game.

deck_name: Master Duel D/D/D - Consistent, Strong and Fun
deck_excerpt: Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel D/D/D Deck - Consistent, Strong and Fun
deck_description: Strong and very consistent D/D/D deck. This deck always wants to go first. The goal is to end your turn with Crystal Wing, High Flame King Genghis and Cursed King Siegfried on the field. This gives you 1 Monster effect negate, 1 spell/trap negate(2 spell/trap negates during your turn) and a monster that can swing over any level 5 or higher monster for 3,000 damage, regardless of how much attack the monster has. Here is an example of a standard combo for the deck:  Combo Pieces Needed: D/D Swirl Slime, D/D Necro Slime, D/D Lamia  As long as you have at least 2 of those 3 combo pieces you can usually search for the 3rd through Dark Contract with the Gate.  Example Hand: D/D Lamia, D/D Swirl Slime, D/D Savant Kepler, Any 2 other cards.  Combo for Example Hand: Normal Summon D/D Savant Kepler, use his effect to search for Dark Contract with the gate. Activate Dark Contract with the Gate. Search for the missing combo piece(in this case, D/D Necro Slime). Activate D/D Swirl Slime's effect, fusion summoning D/D/D Flame King Genghis using D/D Swirl Slime and D/D Necro Slime. Activate D/D Swirl Slime's effect in the graveyard to special summon D/D Lamia. Use D/D Lamia and D/D/D Flame King Genghis to Synchro summon D/D/D Gust King Alexander. Activate D/D Necro Slime's effect in the graveyard to fusion summon D/D/D High Flame King Genghis using D/D Necro Slime and D/D/D Flame King Genghis. Activate D/D/D Gust King Alexander's effect to summon D/D Lamia from the graveyard. Use D/D Lamia and D/D/D Gust King Alexander to Synchro summon D/D/D Cursed King Siegfried. Activate D/D/D High Flame King Genghis to special summon D/D/D Gust King Alexander from the graveyard. Activate D/D Lamia's effect in the graveyard, sending the Dark Contract with the Gate(or any of the cards remaining in your hand) to the graveyard to special summon her from the graveyard. Use D/D Lamia and D/D/D Gust King Alexander to special summon Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon.  There are MANY ways to do this combo within this deck, this is just one example of a standard way of creating your board. If anyone would like any tips/help with D/D/Ds let me know and I can offer my knowledge on the archetype. Pretty cheap deck to make in Master Duel as well. Enjoy! :D

deck_excerpt: Krawler deck using Suma to go through Ghostrick lines and end on Utopic Future Draco.
deck_description: This deck revolves around drawing Krawler Suma and leveraging there amazing ability to create a strong end board. Any Krawler plus Suma can lead to Ghostrick Socuteboss into Ghostrick Angel of Mischief, activate their ability pitching Socuteboss to search Ghostrick shot, summon back Socuteboss, go into your second Angel of Mischief, searching Ghostrick scare, then make Utopic Future then Utopic Draco Future. This will leave two set monsters alongside your Utopic Draco Future and at least one backrow, all off of two cards. We play three World Legacy Survivor to search for Suma, and two Book of Taiyou, to flip Krawler Receptor and search for Suma. The two Lord of the Heavenly Prison are there to protect our set monsters and traps, which we want to have protected to provide interruption during our opponents turn (usually flipping Spine to pop a monster).  Junk Sleep allows us to both flip up monsters, as well as flip them face down again, giving us more value off of our flip summons.
