deck_excerpt: A basic, relatively budget Skull Servant/Wight deck that focus on strong fundamentals and consistency. [Made for Master Duel]
deck_description: This deck is a relatively simple, somewhat budget approach to Skull Servants in Master Duel that only uses a few high rarity cards aside from the meta staples that you should already have. The deck largely runs itself; Clown Zombie mills Baking from deck, Baking grabs Prince & Mare, dumps Prince. Prince mills a Servant and Lady, then banishes those for a King, and Mare discards for a Lady. Pretty basic, but what makes it shine is how versatile the deck can be with the extra deck. Since you have so many low attack monsters, Geonator Transverser can practically steal games by giving the opponent a weakling. Borrelsword can easily be link-climbed into from the basic opener by using Uni-zombie to go into Halqifibrax. And with some very careful planning, you can go from Halq into Shooting Riser into Ametrix and shut down opponent's attacks. Of note is Nibiru. While in most decks, Nibiru requires you to have removal to avoid a massive token, KoSS can often simply overpower the token, especially with the help of Wightprincess. Of the UR's present, i would say that the 3 Un-zombies and one Avendread Savior are non-negotiable. They make it so easy to get what you need, and their ability to discard both from the deck and hand can come in clutch. Many of the others are Staple cards that can be subbed in and out as your budget provides. Thankfully, a majority of the power players here are all found in the same Secret Pack, so 3-4 10pulls will give you most of what you need. As for improvements to the deck, I would look towards MBT's excellent list that utilizes That Grass Looks Greener, found here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PxUO3oLaGcw . Thanks for checking my list out!
Deck in construction - Prototype

deck_name: Ghostrick Angel of Mischief - Six Samurai FTK | Master Duel
deck_excerpt: Infinite drawing power + easy win condition = this deck
deck_description:
https://youtu.be/f95gWHta2JE This deck has carried me to platinum on 3 different accounts easily. Although the stigma to an FTK deck is that it's prone to bricking, this deck is very consistent since the six samurai engine is absolutely broken (I'm looking at you, Gateway of the Six !).

Card Explanation:

Monster Cards:
  • Six Samurai Fuma A monster that you can easily summon with one bushido counter on Shien's Dojo. That's basically the only thing he's used for.
  • Fire Flint Lady An easily summonable warrior monster for Isolde. It can also special summon a level-4 or lower warrior monster from your hand.
  • Legendary Six Samurai - Kageki Useful for first plays since it special summons other level-4 or lower six samurai monsters from your hand. It is also a great discard target for Battle Shogun of the Six Samurai since this card is easily searchable through Isolde
  • Legendary Six Samurai - Shinai A staple for summoning Saryuja Skull Dread, Isolde, Bamboozling Gossip Shadow, Ghostrick Alucard-- basically summons everything.
  • Legendary Six Samurai - Mizuho Basically the same as Shinai, but it can free up your field for some more special summons.
  • Legendary Six Samurai - Kizan An easily summonable monster that is used to summon the XYZ monster that you need.
  • Grandmaster of the Six Samurai An easily summonable monster that is used as a different name for summoning Saryuja Skull Dread
Spell Cards:
  • Monster Reborn Used to be able to extend the combo for summoning Ghostrick Alucard
  • Upstart Goblin A free space on the deck. You can also replace this card with another draw card such as Into the Void
  • Reinforcement of the Army To search for Kizan/Kageki
  • Golden Bamboo Sword Helps with drawing cards you need. It is also easily searchable with Isolde by discarding Cursed Bamboo Sword
  • Shien's Smoke Signal To search for Kageki/Shinai/Mizuho
  • Overlay Regen A staple. You need this card in your hand to add a material to Heraldry Crest
  • Broken Bamboo Sword Used to enable Golden Bamboo Sword
  • Cursed Bamboo Sword Used to search Broken Bamboo Sword / Golden Bamboo Sword, depending on what you need
  • Moon Mirror Shield An Isolde target that can be returned to the deck
  • Living Fossil Another Isolde target, but it can also be used to special summon any level-4 or lower monster from your GY
  • "Infernoble Arms - Durendal" A card that can search for Fire Flint Lady / Mizuho, it is also a target for Isolde
  • Temple of the Six Free Bushido Counter generator
  • Six Samurai United A pot of greed that can generate Bushido Counter if need be
  • Gateway of the Six This card is not once per turn. So you can basically summon an infinite amount of monsters from your deck / GY
  • Shien's Dojo Another Bushido Counter generator, it can also be used as a combo extender to summon Ghostrick Alucard
  • Called by the Grave Just in case your opponent has Maxx "C" or Ash Blossom
Extra Deck:
  • Ghostrick Alucard The target for Heraldry Crest in order to summon Ghostick Angel of Mischief
  • Bamboozling Gossip Shadow Adds 5 materials to your Heraldry Crest
  • Daigusto Emeral You need 2 of this card to do the infinite draw combo. It is also used as a failsafe if your Heraldry Crest or Ghostrick Alucard gets nibiru'd
  • Heraldry Crest Since this card is a Number XYZ Monster, this card can be targeted by Bamboozling Gossip Shadow to add more materials to it. This card's name can be changed to another XYZ Monster's name, this is used to summon Ghostrick Angel of Mischief with 10 materials since after this card's effect is activated, its name becomes Ghostrick Alucard.
  • Ghostrick Angel of Mischief The core of your deck. This card can be summoned with 2 level 4 monsters OR another Ghostrick XYZ monster. If this card has 10 materials, you win the duel
  • Dugares the Timeless A level-4 XYZ monster that lets you draw 2 cards and discard 1 card. Make sure you have a throwable away card in your hand though in case both cards you drew are useful
  • Isolde, Two Tales of the Noble Knights Used to search a discard target and a bamboo sword card. It is also used to special summon a Six Samurai monster for Battle Shogun of the Six Samurai. You can also use this card to bait Ash Blossom
  • Battle Shogun of the Six Samurai Free Bushido Counter generator. Most of the time, you'd want to summon your six samurai monsters to the zone this card points to. This card is also necessary to search for Gateway of the Six if you don't have it in your hand.
  • Saryuja Skull Dread A free draw and a free special summon. Necessary for infinite draws.

Early Game Combo:

  • Summon 2 warrior monsters from your hand using Kageki into another level-4 or lower Six Samurai, a Six Samurai monster + fire flint lady, Mizuho and Shinai, or any Six Samurai monster + Kizan.
  • Summon Isolde using 2 warrior monsters to get a discard target + a bamboo card and to summon a Shinai.
  • Summon Battle Shogun of the Six Samurai using Isolde and another Six Samurai monster. Make sure you bait out any negates such as Ash Blossom, Effect Veiler, Infinite Impermanence, etc before you summon this card.
  • Get Gateway of the Six if you don't have it yet. If you do, get Shien's Dojo for combo extender or Six Samurai United for drawing cards.
  • Special summon any six samurai monsters you have in your hand to get Bushido Counters on both Battle Shogun and Gateway of the Six
  • From here on out, just draw cards using your extra deck monsters such as Dugares, Saryuja, or Daigusto Emeral

Win Condition Combo:

  • Summon Heraldry Crest first
  • Then summon Bamboozling Gossip Shadow
  • Activate Bamboozling Gossip Shadow, target Heraldry Crest
  • Use either Monster Reborn, Living Fossil, or Shien's Dojo to special summon any level-3 Six Samurai
  • Summon another level-3 using Gateway of the Six
  • Summon Ghostrick Alucard with the two level-3 monsters you summoned before
  • Activate Heraldry Crest, and target Ghostrick Alucard. Heraldry Crest's name is now Ghostrick Alucard
  • Activate Overlay Regen, target Heraldry Crest
  • Summon Ghostrick Angel of Mischief using Heraldry Crest
So how does one get to summon and draw all of those cards? Daigusto Emeral + Saryuja Skull Dread is absolutely broken, and with 2 Daigusto Emerals, it's basically an infinite draw. How? you may ask, here's the combo:

Infinite Draw Combo:

  • Use Saryuja Skull Dread's effect to draw 4 cards, and return 3 to the deck
  • Summon Mizuho and Shinai using Gateway of the Six
  • Activate Mizuho's effect to tribute Shinai and destroy Saryuja Skull Dread
  • Shinai's effect will activate in the graveyard to add 1 Six Samurai monster to your hand, add Kizan
  • Special summon 2 Kizans, 1 from Shinai's effect and 1 from Gateway of the Six
  • Summon Daigusto Emeral, activate its effect to add Saryuja, Daigusto Emeral, and another monster of your choice (preferably level-3 monsters)
  • You can then summon Saryuja again and activate its effect since both Daigusto Emeral and Saryuja Skull Dread are not a hard once per turn.

What this deck is weak to:

  • Early Nibiru Nibiru is absolutely devastating if you don't have Shien's Dojo or Monster Reborn in your hand/field. But if you have either of those, it's still fine.
  • Bricking This is a common problem for most decks, honestly. Although yes, this deck is consistent, it is as consistent as most decks, so there is still a possibility for bricking. A brick hand would be 5 spells that do not summon or add a Six Samurai monster to your hand/field, and that's basically it.
  • Battle Shogun being negated while not having Gateway of the Six in your hand/field. Gateway of the Six is the core of this deck. If you don't have it, or if you can't search for it, it's basically game.
  • Going Second Going second against a meta deck would be a game-ender since most meta decks right now are revolved around negates.

deck_excerpt: I can't believe Aromages can do this!
deck_description:
It's a plant synchro deck, but it uses Aromage cards as the initial jumpstart to the combo! Standard 2-card combo Lonefire Blossom+ Aromage Laurel
  1. NS Lonefire
  2. Tribute Lonefire, searching Evil Thorn
  3. Tribute Evil Thorn for 2 Evil Thorns
  4. Make Aromaseraphy Jasmine and SS Laurel to 1 of Jasmine's Arrows
  5. Tribute Laurel with Jasmine, SS Predaplant Orphys Scorpio (Scorpio) and searching Aromaseraphy Angelica with Jasmine's LP gain effect
  6. Scorpio's effect SS Predaplant Darlingtonia Cobra (Cobra) by sending Angelica from hand to GY, searching Instant Fusion
  7. Angelica SS herself from GY
  8. Link Summon Cross-Sheep with Jasmine and either Cobra or Scorpio
  9. Instant Fusion Sea Monster of Theseus onto 1 of Cross-Sheep's Arrows, SSing Lonefire from GY
  10. Tribute Lonefire Blossom with its own effect to SS Spore from deck
  11. Link Summon Crystron Needlefiber Halqifibrax with Sea Monster of Theseus and Cross-Sheep, SS Rose Girl from deck
  12. Synchro Summon Aromaseraphy Sweet Marjoram with Scorpio/Cobra and Rose Girl, searching Blessed Winds (Search Humid Winds if you already have BW)
  13. Synchro Summon Periallis with Marjoram and Spore, then SS Marjoram with Periallis' effect
  14. Synchro Summon Borreload Savage Dragon with Periallis and Angelica, equipping Jasmine
  15. SS Spore from GY with its own effect, banishing an Evil Thorn to make it level 2
  16. Synchro Summon Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon with Majoram and Spore (level 2)
  17. Set Blessed Winds and pass
  18. On opponent's chain, use Blessed Winds to SS Majoram from GY and Needlefiber's Halqifibrax's effect to SS Shooting Riser Dragon (SRD)
  19. SRD effect to send a level 3 from deck to make it level 4
  20. Use SRD effect to Synchro Summon Baronne de Fleur with Majoram and SRD
You can also end on F.A. Dawn Dragster instead if it's a match-up where multiple S/T negates are needed. Just send Bergamot instead to make SRD level 1 and Synchro Summon with Majoram. The rest of the deck is about getting to your plant engines as quickly as possible. Monster Reborn/World Legacy Succession allow playing around handtraps like Effect Veiler/Infinite Impermanence if you use the negated monster as Link material for Sunavalon Dryas. Also having Humid Winds/Aroma Gardening on board adds a Drident-like effect (pseudo-quick effect targeted destruction) when you SS Marjoram off of the Blessed Winds alongside the endboard made.

With a single thought I just decided to make this.  60 card adventurer decks are dominating right now, Ursarctics just got a card to let them draw 7, it’s pretty easy for me to draw into my other combo pieces using the black lister soldier stuff to maintain card advantage and set up a win con with a hand rip bonus too.  Overall on paper this particular idea may have some potential but probably not a lot. But it definitely seems fun!

deck_name: We do a little trolling with shaddolls without reason
deck_description: (google translate)  Well, this is a somewhat basic prankid deck, but with shaddolls for no apparent reason xd I like to play pure prankids but I don't have enough hand traps or staples to fill the remaining spaces, so looking for a good engine, I found the shaddoll, very simple really, with access to winda, with the right cards, you can give a block to special summons with battle butler and winda  I was testing this recipe and I really like it, it almost never bricks, from the deck, 16 cards (the prankids, place, and terraforming) can access 1 card combo plays. the basic combo to get to battle butler, if you have a second prankid in hand, it only consists of 4 summons (first prankid, meow meow, second prankid and dodo without summoning another prankid)  I have seen many combos on reddit to play prank kids, so I want to share them with you all  combo 1 (a prankid in this case let's say fansies and a card to discard) step 1.- normal summon fansies, link 1 meow meow, send prankids pranks to the graveyard, and summon dropsies step 2.- dropsies+meow meow for dodo, chain one dodo, chain two dropsies, summon torchsies, add pandemonium to hand step 3.- activate pandemonium by merging dodo and torchsies to summon rocket ride and by effect of lampsies, you summon rocksies step 4.-use rocket ride effect to return to the dodo and fansies step 5.- dodo effect to return pandemonium and pranks step 6.-link 2 bow bow bark with fansies and rocksies, and activate rocksies effect by discarding the card we had in hand to summon a fansies step 7.- activate pranks and set pandemonium, and grant turn step 8.- at the end of the turn, return with pranks effect, to the dodo, a copy of rocksies and rocket ride to the deck to draw a card step 9.- in the opponent's stand by, activate bow bow bark effect and add lampsies and lampsies step 10.- activate pandemonium, fusing the fansies that we left on the field and the two prankids that we added in the previous step, to summon battle butler, and since you summoned the prankids in another turn, you can activate the three effects of the prank kids  combo 2 (anti nibiru) (two prank kids, lets say, lampsies and fansies)  step 1.- normal summon fansies, link 1 meow meow, send pranks to the graveyard and summon dropsies step 2.- dropsies+meow meow for dodo, chain 1 dodo, chain 2 dropsies, resolve, but don't cast with the second dropsies effect, and add pandemonium step 3.- dodo effect and you return to the hand to dropsies and fansies step 4.- set pandemonium and pass turn step 5.- in standby, you activate pandemonium and with the 3 prankids in hand, you summon battle butler, and since it was the opponent's turn, you can fill the field by activating the effects of the 3 prankids

deck_excerpt: It's Synchro Goodstuff deck that turbos out Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon and Stardust Dragon/Assault Mode... that's really all there is to say about it
deck_description:
Hi, Grayewick the Fusionist here, back with a Synchro Deck for the Synchro Festival (...duh) that might look familiar to some if not most of you, especially for those who have been playing the game for quite some time now. Presenting, Synchro Goodstuff. "Why play this deck?" Well... the Synchro Festival is up, and if you're tired of playing the same shit, and by that I mean Virtual World, here's a more of an old school classic of a strategy, and if you might have noticed, this engine is all gas and nothing but Synchro 8 engines. I will discuss more of the nuances in the list as I go through the individual cards. This list's game plan only revolves around one thing: Synchro Summon Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon and/or bring out Stardust Dragon/Assault Mode as quick as you can and use them to either aggressively interrupt your opponent at their most crucial choke points or defensively depending on the situation. Anyway, the list. The Main Deck, where I will discuss in engines: • The Assault Mode engine - This is the first half of your strategy, which only has one goal in mind and that is to bring out its archetypal boss monster Stardust Dragon/Assault Mode as quick as it can. Here's their effects:
  1. Stardust Dragon/Assault Mode - Your first boss monster. Requires a Stardust Dragon to be tributed for its Special Summon but that's hardly a problem for a deck that can turbo out Level 8 Synchros. Has a once per turn omni negation effect, and can bring itself back during the End Phase of the turn it is used.
  2. Psi-Reflector - Your main starter of the engine and is the Tuner, with a great and versatile level of 1 for any Synchro focused strategy, and both a Search effect to initiate your combos and a Level modulating effect that can be relevant to your needs.
  3. Assault Sentinel - Your secondary starter of the engine. Brings out Psi-Reflector from the Deck, and has a Type modulating effect that is actually valuable in other strategies, but not on this one since Levels are our only concern.
  4. Assault Beast - Your main search target if you didn't open Assault Sentinel to search Assault Mode Activate.
  5. Assault Teleport - Allows you to fix your hand in case you drew your Stardust Dragon/Assault Mode, and draws you 2 cards.
  6. Assault Mode Activate - The centerpiece of the Deck, you always want to have at least 1 copy of this card in your hand, and that's why we play 2 of it. It enables your Psi-Reflector's effect and allows you to bring out Stardust Dragon/Assault Mode during your opponent's turn. Your secondary search target if you opened Assault Sentinel.
• The Ascator engine - A one card Synchro 8 engine that only consists of two cards, being Ascator, Dawnwalker and Fire Ant Ascator as his target. • The Dragunity engine - This list actually contains two Dragunity engines. The first one being Dragunity Dux, Dragunity Phalanx, and Dragunity Knight - Vajrayana, a more fragile one card combo that requires your Normal Summon with the help of a graveyard setup, usually facilitated by Cards of Consonance, and the second newer one consisted of Dragunity Remus, Dragunity Legatus, Dragunity Knight - Gae Dearg, and Mist Valley Baby Roc, both of which can easily bring out Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon under 5 Summons, the only difference is that the latter does not consume your Normal Summon. • The Windwitch engine - This engine is usually used alongside Speedroids, since they are not only synergistic lore-wise but also in game. It xenolocks us from Special Summoning other monsters but WIND attribute monsters, but it doesn't really matter outside of the Assault Mode and the Ascator engine. Here are their effects:
  1. Windwitch - Ice Bell - You'd ideally want to start with her since she has an effect that allows herself to be Special Summoned if you control no other monsters.
  2. Windwitch - Glass Bell - She has an effect that allows you to search a "Windwitch" monster upon her Normal or Special Summon, except a copy of herself.
  3. Windwitch - Snow Bell - She has an effect that allows herself to be Special Summoned if you control 2 or more WIND attribute monsters, which we play more than enough of.
• The Staples
  1. Cards of Consonance - Provides draw power and GY setup. Not once per turn.
  2. Pot of Avarice - Provides draw and recycling power which will be helpful on cases where you have opening hands that have a dead Stardust Dragon/Assault Mode and you have no other choice but to use it as a discard fodder for anything.
  3. Monster Reborn - Reborns a monster.
  4. Emergency Teleport - Provides access to the Assault Mode engine without costing your Normal Summon of the turn. Can be activated during the Draw and Standby Phase of your turn, which plays around Droll & Lock Bird.
  5. Dragon Ravine - Targets for Dragunity Remus, and is an essential component for the Dragunity engine. Provides either GY setup or a search.
The Extra Deck • Baronne De Fleur - It's no coincidence that she got released before the event. If you have a deck that can occasionally bring her out, there's no reason not to. She has a OPT pop effect, once per face up negation effect, and an effect that allows herself to be recycled in order to revive any Level 9 or lower monster in your GY, which would be more often either Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon or a Stardust Dragon. • Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon - The boss monster of the deck. Has both a monster negation effect that boosts its own ATK and another ATK boosting effect when it battles any Level 5 or higher monster during the Damage Calculation. • Psy-Framelord Omega - If you can make it in a Synchro deck, there's no reason not to. • Stardust Dragon - Has a decent negation effect against destruction card effects, but it's only relevant as a target for Stardust Dragon/Assault Mode. • Dragunity Knight - Barcha - A stepping stone to make Baronne De Fleur. • Clear Wing Synchro Dragon - Has arguably better negation effects than Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon since it has two instead of just one, but does not have the combat protection through ATK boosting. • Windwitch - Winter Bell - A stepping stone to make Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon for the Windwitches. Has a burn effect that is always welcome than having nothing else. • Dragunity Knight - Gae Dearg - A stepping stone to make Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon for the Dragunities, usually through Dragunity Remus and Dragunity Legatus. • Dragunity Knight - Vajrayana - A stepping stone to make Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon for the Dragunities, usually through Dragunity Dux and Dragunity Phalanx. Final Thoughts: I mean... it's Crystal Wing/Assault Mode engine turbo.dek. Sure, some people might say that it's a boring way to play the event but, Crystal Wing is a good boss monster, and so is Stardust Dragon/Assault Mode, and if it does the job right, you know... can you really complain? Gotta get those gems somehow, am I right? As per usual, if you have any questions or thoughts, feel free to express them down in the comments and I'll respond to them as soon as I possibly can.

deck_description: https://youtu.be/NdNdMgVRXnk

This is a neat little combo deck that has some neat plays  Main Combo:  (snake rain + ogdo + coatl/ramifications)  activate snake rain sending the 3 ogdo names you didn't discard and night sword serpent  Summon serpent  tribute serpent for keurse  keurse summon nauya  nauya search water lily  nunu summon from grave  tribute nunu for aleirtt  aleirtt put nunu and serpent in grave  summon coatl  coatl and nauya make mathmech magma  magma and an 8 make bishbaalkin in emz  bishbaalkin summon 4 tokens to both player's fields  link bishbaalkin and the other ogdo on field for echidna  use 2 tokens to go into I:P  echidna search vaskii, kid, nyami, and masked chameleon  tribute 2 tokens on your opponent's side of the field for vaskii  pop a token on your opponent's side of the field with vaskii  link vaskii and echidna zer'oll  zer'oll search virus  normal kid  water lily mill ogdoabyss to then res ogdoabyss  end board is negate all effects of special summoned monsters, field nuke + lingering negate(virus), link away an opponent's monster for underworld goddess, and a second field nuke.  Pros: is cool, has some very strong cards.  Cons: loses to every handtrap ever made.

deck_excerpt: Another Galaxy-Eyes deck, just with a few personal changes here and there for what I feel is better consistency.
deck_description: Still some bricking, but not as bad as some other decks, and if you can survive a turn you'll usually draw into something to get your combos started  One each of Knight and Brave since I felt like I was bricking too much with more than one of each 2 Vanishers since 3 never felt necessary One wizard because personally I don't summon him too often and when I do, he's my normal summon so I VERY rarely want two in hand Dragon Buster to lock opponents out of the extra deck for however long - swap this with a second Wizard if you'd like but know that it can only be equipped through Union Carrier's effect to other dragons Nebula Dragon - Basically a free rank 8 especially if you don't see a way to get out GEPD or any other level 8  in your hand BUT you should know it locks you into only summoning dragons for the rest of your turn, so make sure you can win that turn or survive if you play this Galaxy Trance - Pretty good for late game as long as you can pay the cost, but I don't really see the need for more than one. Searchable with Wizard's effect 2 Galaxy Expedition - 3 also feels unnecessary 1 Lightning Storm - Just a going second card to bait or even wipe if you can  Extra deck Ahashima - For late game and to basically turn two level 4's into a rank 8 1 Photon Lord - Most decks run 2. You can if you want I just needed room Draglubion and Numeron Dragon - I was playing Nova and Infinity and the two of them are extremely consistent in this deck, I just got bored of it because you can honestly summon them almost every game. That being said I recommend playing one or the other unless you decide to take out maybe Zues and Ahashima.
Please make suggestions on how to make this deck more consistent I've never played it before.  Yu-Gi-Oh!

deck_excerpt: O Deck Temático Renascimento dos Verdadeiros Dragões contém 40 cartas para celebrar a dedicação dos Duelistas aos Decks de Dragões!
deck_description: A temporada dos Dragões está aberta em Yu-Gi-Oh! ESTAMPAS ILUSTRADAS. Os Duelistas dos Decks de Dragões ficarão novamente empolgados com o Deck Temático Renascimento dos Verdadeiros Dragões!  Esse Deck de 40 estampas é para celebrar a estratégia dos grandes Dragões utilizada por Seto Kaiba na série animada clássica de Yu-Gi-Oh!. O Deck inclui Dragões com Níveis 7 e 8 capazes de banir cartas do oponente quando forem Invocados, ganhando mais pontos de ataque para cada carta banida. Também estão inclusos novos monstros Sincro e XYZ fáceis de Invocar para ajudar seus Dragões rapidamente. A melhor parte é que esse deck funciona com QUALQUER Dragão de Nível 7 ou 8, incluindo os Dragões de outros Decks e coleções.  O verdadeiro trunfo do Deck Temático Renascimento dos Verdadeiros Dragões é um card de Magia que permite a Invocação de qualquer Dragão de Nível 7 ou 8 diretamente do Cemitério sem restrições, além de poder ser utilizada posteriormente para proteger seus Dragões da destruição, sem inconvenientes ou limitações. É um card essencial para todos os Decks de Dragões!  O Deck Temático Renascimento dos Verdadeiros Dragões contém 40 cartas para celebrar mais de uma década da dedicação dos Duelistas aos Decks de Dragões!

deck_excerpt: Insect deck focusing on using Cicada King and Seraphim Papillon as disruption
deck_description: Insects is one of my favorite decks in all of YGO and this is the result of a lot of games played. Rather than going for Giant Ballpark or Cocoon of Evolution plays i decided that the most consistent way to play the deck was to focus on getting insects disruption onto the board. I found that Danger's and Sekka's Light made my combos much more consistent allowing me to get at the very least a Seraphim Papillon and a Number 3: Cicada King onto the board with Battlewasp: Sting the Poison and/or Scary Moth in the graveyard or hand as summonable targets on my opponents board. The deck can make use of Baronne De Fleur, Desert Locusts and Crystron Halqifibrax as additional or alternative interaction to the monsters mentioned before.

deck_excerpt: Synchro to some crazy monsters with massive negates

If and when Doppelwarrior gets sent to the graveyard with any synchro summon, gives you the tokens needed to go into some of the low level Tuner synchro monsters for some of the larger scale monsters     There's a lot of flexibility with my deck build and you can do with it as you please. I only ask that you don't roast me, because I only use this deck with friends so I can just have fun, hence why all the hand traps are in the side deck, rather than in the main

deck_excerpt: TCG COMPLIANT budget competitive orcust deck.
deck_description: TCG Banlist compliant orcust deck, has counters to almost every competitive deck. Tried to make it budget friendly but due to the need for staples and combo extenders it's quite high in the low-end category.  Ideally plays second to respond with cards like dingirsu, rusty bardiche, and dharc; can also play first and interrupt with babel.  This deck plays the dragon link engine to quickly get DARK effect monsters on the field as link or synchro material, the phantom knights' engine as a combo extender / board break when paired with dingirsu - as well as a few negates and searches, and the sky striker engine to build material turn 1. Previous lists included trickstars however they were since removed for causing bricks and wasting a normal summon or the field spell slot.  My favourite matchup is vs. red-eyes, or really any deck with the dragoon engine. If you don't have a kaiju in hand, bait the negate and then go into ding with any 2 effect monsters, sending dragoon to the grave. Then, use ding and one other DARK monster to go into dharc the dark charmer and steal their dragoon from grave. You get a free negate, and your opponent is very sad. Cymbal can also revive ding from your grave next turn if you would like to keep destruction protection on the field.  This deck uses effect veiler as its main handtrap to ensure that chaos ruler will have material to revive itself after destruction, and it's a cheaper alternative to ash blossom while still having some of the upsides and downsides. I run raidan as my kaiju of choice since it is a dark monster, so if necessary I can play it mid-turn while being locked into DARK summons. There's also a gadarla in the side deck if you get statued. While I tend to avoid LP cost cards, I do run a destrudo since it can turbo clear wing, or be used as material for crystron halqifibrax without a normal summon (which can then search a bombard for even more combos). I don't play any "pot of" cards in this deck as I have found that banishing cards that are only played at 1-2 copies can significantly slow or even instantly scoop the deck, and I can't play duality because I need my normal summon. There are some other choices I made when building this deck that seem wrong compared to other, but I can't list them all here since it would be a very long paragraph.  If you need any help learning the deck or you would like to contact me, drop a message to hhez#7601  Thanks for taking time to check out my deck, I spent a LOT of time refining this through competitive gameplay and it was rather expensive to do so. If you found this helpful, please like the decklist. :)
Let me know if you see any possible improvements  Can it compete?

deck_excerpt: Learn to play Virtual World at Master Duel Synchro Festival
deck_description: Virtual World is an Archetype of Psychic and Wyrm Monsters focused on Synchro Summoning and XYZ Summoning, it is one of the most competitively durable Archetypes since its launch and was an absolute Tier 1 in the physical card game while True King of All Calamities existed because it was the best deck in the game to make VFD Turbo which is one of the best Floodgate Monsters in the game and can be compared to the Cancer called Mystic Mine because it does almost the same thing of preventing monster effects from being activated and also preventing the opponent's monsters from declaring attacks. Even with the loss of the VFD Virtual World didn't need much time to fit the best way to play but now it's turned to a more friendly combo where you pass with solid interactions and a lot of advantage and follow up in the process. The main features that make Virtual World a unique deck in the game is mainly its way of playing which is a very smart card design and the restrictions that Archetype itself has when starting to play on te lock in Special Summoning only Monsters that have Level/Rank 3 or higher. This means that after resolving the effects of the Main Deck monsters that activate from the hand, you can only Summon Monsters from the Main Deck of Level 3 or higher, and regarding the Extra Deck you will only have the disposal to make Synchro Monsters of Level 3 or higher and Rank-3 or higher XYZ monsters. And since virtually all Virtual World monsters are Level 3 or Level 6 you will almost always be limited to making Level 6, 9, and 12 Synchro Monsters and Rank 3, 6, 9, and 12 XYZ Monsters. , this deck does not use LINK Monsters to play even though you can technically Link Summon before activating the Virtual World Monsters effects in 99% of decklists you will not see any LINK monsters being used in the Extra Deck which brings even more credibility to the gameplay of this archetype since there is no need to use LINK-2 Enabler to play differently from several Metagame decks that would become 10 times worse than they are without Crystron Halqifibrax, Predaplant Verte Anaconda, Isolde, Two Tales of the Noble Knights, Aromaseraphy Jasmine, Cherubini, Ebon Angel of the Burning Abyss among other generic LINK cards that may be banned in the near future. The biggest problem with Virtual World has always been the issue of Consistency because when it comes out of inertia this is one of the most resilient decks in the game as you work with Archetype card movement in all possible places: hand effects, field effects , GY effects and even banned cards are relevant. That's why you dodge many interactions in the form of Hand Trap when playing from Virtual World like Effect Veiler and Infinite Impermanence and even high impact Hand Traps like Nibiru, the Primal Being and Artifact Lancea can be won by the simple factor of opening with multiple Virtual World names in hand. //////////////////////////////////////////////////The deck's gameplay is based on the 3 types of cards in the game: Monsters, Spells and Traps. Basically you start your moves by activating the effects of the following Virtual World Monsters in your hand: Mai-Hime - Lulu, Xiezhi - Jiji, Kirin - Lili and Roshi - Laolao and for that they have a common requirement of needing to target a Virtual World card on your field to activate its effects and take an action and Special Summon it from your hand. The action they take is for you to send a Virtual World card from your Deck to the Graveyard of a different Type than the Virtual World card on the field you targeted to activate its effect. For example if you target a Monster like Nyannyan you must send a Spell or Trap from Virtual World to the GY for the monster to Special Summon, if it is targeted in a Spell like Qinglong you send a Monster or Trap and if for a Trap like Chuche you send a Monster or a Spell to the GY. These monsters do yet another action when Special Summoned: Mai-Hime - Lulu adds a Virtual World card from your Deck to your hand of a Third Type different from the card you targeted on the field and the one you sent to the GY , so if you targeted a Monster and sent Spell Qinglong to the GY for example you can add a Trap to your hand like Chuche which makes it the best card in the Deck as it gives you access to 2 Potential Virtual names World to continue playing and generate a lot of advantage and game volume in addition to being a Tuner Monster. Xiezhi - Jiji has the perk effect of retaining Follow Up in the End Phase of your turn when adding a Virtual World Monster from your GY to your hand. Kirin - Lili can send a Virtual World card from your Deck to the GY of a Third type different from the card you targeted on the field and the first one you sent to the GY, so if you targeted a Trap like Chuche for example and sent Spell Qinglong to GY you can add send a Virtual World Monster to GY like Nyannyan. And finally Roshi - Laolao is the best Extender of the deck since in addition to being a Tuner Monster it has the additional effect of giving Monster Reborn from a Virtual World in your GY in Defense Position (and with the effects negated) which allows you to make very aggressive plays. A curiosity about these effects of handheld Virtual World Monsters as well as Archetype Drytron Monsters such as Drytron Alpha Thuban for example is that in the resolution of the Special Summon effect you resolve the additional advantage effect of the card, that is, at the same time as you Special Summoned Mai-Hime - Lulu to the field you will add a Virtual World card to the hand and that way this deck has great resilience to cards that negate monster effects on the field like Infinite Impermanence and Skill Drain with you being able to even OTK over the effect of Floodgates like Skill Drain because it doesn't affect your build play, but rather affects the Extra Deck monsters you bring onto the field only. Usually you always access Lulu in all Combos whether Turn 1 or Grind Game, Lili is a great Starter also on turn 1 but in the next turns he gets a little weakened since you already have so many Virtual World cards in the GY and banned that its added effect of sending one more Virtual World card to the GY becomes a bit redundant. Laolao is not a good Starter because its additional effect is only relevant when you already have Virtual World Monsters in your GY but it is an excellent Extender and Follow Up in the deck and finally Jiji is a good card to have at your disposal throughout the game. The only Virtual World Monsters in the Main Deck that do not have a Hand effect are Nyannyan and Toutou, as Toutou is little explored in the deck I will focus only on Nyannyan but the basic purpose of the two cards is the same: They are the main Normal Summons of the deck since Virtual World does not need to be Normal Summoned to play but even then you will often not have a Virtual World Spell/Trap to target and activate the effects of hand Virtual Worlds so you will need to Normal Summon these cards to the field to start playing. Nyannyan being a Level 3 Psychic Monster can be Special Summoned straight from the Deck with Emergence Teleport and that way you have 4 copies of Nyannyan in the deck to increase consistency, plus Nyannyan has a very good GY effect to come back to the field if you Normal or Special Summon a Level 3 Monster, with the detail of becoming a Tuner Monster and that will be banished when it leaves the field for a Synchro Summon for example. And finally if that wasn't enough it has an excellent effect when it is banned from you to target any card in your ban zone (except itself) and shuffle back into the deck. The detail of this effect is that you can shuffle Face-Down cards that you banished with the activation of Pot of Desires for example so even if an important card of your deck mainly the Virtual World Spells/Traps that are important to keep in circulation in the Deck you can recover for use in the next turn. That way even the Pot of Desires Drawback can be mitigated in the Virtual World deck. //////////////////////////////////////////////////And to complete the excellent Main Deck of Virtual World we have the Spells/Traps: starting with the Spells we have the Kauwloon which is an excellent Starter of the deck because it simply place any of the Spell/Trap Virtual World Gate directly from the Deck to the field being the main move put Chuche face-up since targeting Trap is the best type of card to resolve the effects of the hand's Virtual Worlds in addition to Chuche being an interaction by itself in the form of a pop of Face-Up cards on the field (including your own cards) by giving 2 banished Virtual World Cards Shuffle back to the deck, but we can also put Qinglong on the field in some situations if we want to negate the effect of an opponent's Monster like El Shaddoll Winda and that's enough banish the very Kauwloon you used to place Qinglong face-up. Kauwloon also has additional effects according to the number of "Virtual World Gate" Card you control at card resolution highlighting the Bonus effect of your Virtual World monsters gaining 200ATK and for the effect of Sending the top 3 cards of your Deck for the GY. Detail: it is because of the possibility that in the Kauwloon resolution you have 3 "Virtual World Gate" face-up Cards on the field that your opponent can give Ash Blossom in the Kauwloon effect. All Virtual World Gate Spells/Traps shine in terms of GY effects and are essential in building plays: Qinglong is nothing less than the Archetype's ROTA in Spell form because it can banish itself from GY to add a Monster Virtual World from the Deck to the hand and at resolution you must discard a card from the hand. Chuche, in addition to being an absurd interaction card that destroys face-up cards on the field every turn while recycling your banished Virtual World cards back to the Deck, it also has a great GY effect from during your Main Phase if you banish yourself to target a Virtual World Monster and increase or decrease its Level by 3 allowing for excellent Synchro and XYZ plays. Finally, just talk about Xuanwu, which is basically the Archetype's Monster Reborn, bringing him with the effects negated and in the resolution, just like Qinglong, you have to discard a card from your hand to the GY. Xuanwu has a field effect in the Battle Phase of changing a monster's battle position but you rarely use it to your advantage since pretty much the only time you activate it on the field is when you brick and you still have to control another "Virtual World" Gate" to activate this effect, that is, uncommon to happen but it is useful to prevent the opponent from doing AA-ZEUS in Main Phase 2 when putting his XYZ Monster in Defense Position for example. //////////////////////////////////////////////////Extra Deck's Virtual World monsters are divided between Synchro 6 and 9 and XYZ Rank 3 and 6. Some of them have the particularity of having effects that mention Monsters with the SAME Type and Attribute or Monsters with DIFFERENT Types and Attributes and the Virtual World Monsters are split between WIND Psychic and EARTH Wyrm so that these effects can take place. Often non-Archetype monsters like Synchro and generic XYZ and Deck-used Hand Traps like Ash Blossom and Psy-Framegear Gamma fall into these requirements for DIFFERENT Types and Attributes. In general the XYZ RANK-3 are little used despite having good interaction effects, highlighting the Shell - Jaja which is an easy way to make AA-ZEUS from above as it can protect itself from destruction in battle. RANK-6 Phoenix - Fanfan is an excellent card that should definitely be used in Virtual World decks because it has the effect of banishing a card that the opponent controls and 1 card in his GY also being double interaction and also has a great floating effect when destroyed to Special Summon 2 "Virtual World" Monsters with the SAME Type and Attribute. Kyubi - Shenshen is the Deck's Synchro-9 Boss Monster and has a Floodgate effect that perfectly matches the Archetype: Macro Cosmos theme for any card that would be sent from the field to the GY. As you have Chuche to shuffle the banished cards back to the deck you don't mind playing over Shenshen's Floodgate effect different from your opponent who will have a complete nightmare when trying to play this "Macro Cosmos with legs" because virtually no Link Summon decks can play with Link materials being banished instead of going to the GY, the same goes for Synchro decks that need to send monsters from the field to the GY as well, Pendulum Monsters are banished instead of going for the face-up Extra Deck, Eldlich and True Draco Cards also lose all their value when they leave the field because they are banished, only XYZ Monster decks can play a little around Shenshen because XYZ Material is not considered a card in the field and are not banned when detaching from Monster XYZ. And to make your opponent worse, it's no use taking Shenshen off the field because he himself returns to the field on the next turn without being the one sent to the GY when banishing 2 Monsters from your GY with DIFFERENT Original Types and Attributes. Finally we have the Synchro-6 Beast - Jiujiu which is another interaction card with the opponent from the Virtual World deck that sends any card on the field to the GY when banishing 2 Monsters in your GY with the SAME Original Type and Attribute, and it still protects itself from destruction by battle or card effects while you have 2 or More Monsters in your GY with SAME Orginal Type and Attribute, but different names. //////////////////////////////////////////////////As soon as you resolve 1 of the Hand Effects of Virtual World Monsters you can make the default end board of the deck by easy access to Lulu with Qinglong. So you don't need a lot of cards to play turn 1, just going along that you'll need more extend to get over your opponent's interactions. It's about maintaining Card Advantage while you play and knowing how to manage your resources because Virtual World is one of the best Grind Game decks in the game for the ease of recycling all the cards even if banned, having a constant game volume. I've even come across my opponent using Solemn Judgment to negate Shenshen's summon and I simply used Qinglong I had on the field to banish Shenshen and negate any monster on the field and then I used Nyannyan eff when banished to return Shenshen to Extra Deck, so it's very simple to keep pressure on the opponent with your Boss Monster coming back every turn. //////////////////////////////////////////////////Basic combos for SYNCHRO FESTIVAL, I'm sure some of these combos can be done more efficiently because I'm not an expert in this deck leaving it up to you to improve what can be improved. A detail in some combos is that I'm only using Geomathmech Final Sigma in my Master Duel build because I don't want to Craft Ultimaya Tzolkin and Crystal Wing so in these combos I talk about doing Final Sigma instead of Ultimaya Tzolkin and what happens is that you pretty much always make these cards the same way because even though Ultimaya Tzolkin has no level in the Extra Deck you always make it using a Level 6 Tuner Monster and a Level 6 non-Tuner in the Virtual World deck which is the same way to do Final Sigma. The real detail is to remember that you can't do Ultimaya Tzolkin if Shenshen is on the field so always do the Tzolkin first before Shenshen and that you'll need to set a Spell/Trap to bring Crystal Wing to the field and in the combos themselves you have this option because many times you use Mai-Hime - Lulu to add Kauwloon to the hand or Chuche so you can first set these cards on the field to trigger eff of Ultimaya Tzolkin and then if it is Kauwloon you activate to put Chuche face-up but of course you could set a Pot of Desires or an Infinite Impermanence to have the same result in cases where you don't have a Virtual World Spell/Trap in hand, so these are the details of using Tzolkin's engine and Crystal Wing on the Virtual World deck. //////////////////////////////////////////////////LULU COMBOS: COMBO 1: Lulu + Kauwloon + 1 Discard (Lili ROTA) Kauwloon Place Chuche on Field and Lulu tgt Chuche send Qinglong Add Lili Qinglong eff Add Jiji and Random Discard Lili eff tgt Lulu send Nyan and Qinglong Jiji eff tgt Lulu send Chuche and Nyan eff Reborn from GY SYNCHRO 9 Shenshen(using Lulu) Chuche eff on Nyan +3 and SYNCHRO 9 Qinglong /Banished: 2 VW Cards //////////////////////////////////////////////// //Technoplay: Not wanting to be the owner of reason but I consider that playing Virtual World in Master Duel without 3 Pot of Desires and without the Psy-Framegear Gamma package is playing completely wrong with this deck. This is the best deck to use Pot of Desires because you don't care about any downside of the card whether it's the risk of banishing an important card or drawing more copies of Desires itself so you should maximize this card for the highest possible probability to see it in the starting hand or during the Draws of Extra Deck monsters during the standard Deck Combo. And the Psy-Framegear Gamma works like a Called By the Grave in this deck because it can always protect you from taking interactions in the form of a Hand Trap in the first Virtual World effect you resolve in your hand, in addition to being the best hand trap by itself high impact in the game as it not only negates the monster but also destroys it, an essential versatility card that should be at 3 on the Master Duel banlist instead of semi-limited. About Pot of Desires: If you already have plays you don't start using Desires, but first try to play and access the engine cards so that when you use Desires you don't have the risk of banishing some important combo piece especially Xuanwu which is the only one-off engine card, but also having access to Chuche and Qinglong's second copy in circulation makes a difference. So it's more about you accessing the Virtual World Spells/Traps before using Desires because the Virtual World monsters themselves practically never make a difference when banned even in 2 copies because the important thing is to have a copy of them available and not multiples. Pot of Desires and Nyannyan Interaction: if you have Nyannyan on the field that came back from the GY by its own effect and Desires in hand, you first use Desires before Synchro Summoning using Nyannyan because if you banish a card that you want to return to the deck with Desires, that Nyannyan will play that role but if you Synchro Summon first you won't get that chance to recycle the right card back into the deck. A very important detail that some people forget about using the Tzolkin in the Virtual World deck is that it conflicts with the Shenshen in the summon condition because you necessarily need to send the materials for the Tzolkin's Special Summon to the GY but this is impossible to do happens while you're under the effect of Shenshen so you can't do Tzolkin if Shenshen is on the field and that's why in plays involving Tzolkin you do Shenshen only towards the end of the Combo. In very specific situations you can use Qinglong to negate your own Shenshen if you are going to make a Synchro move that needs materials to be sent to the GY. It was necessary to have a lot of VW monsters from the GY for turn 3 plays, whether in giving Reborn from Shenshen or to other cards like Laolao and Xuanwu. Returning Nyannyan to the GY with Shenshen eff in Battle Phase proved to be very necessary in the grind game and many times I want to go to the Battle Phase to return it and then in the M2 I special Lulu or Jiji to trigger Nyan. When you play without Spells/Traps Virtual World as a target too many times to resolve the second VW effect you will have to do one of Archetype's Synchro Monsters and not Stardust Warrior etc to continue playing. Always analyze when your play is stopped on the only VW name you had if there is a way you can try to ensure you have a target on the table as a target for the next turn because if not you can even stop the opponent with the various hand traps that fit in the deck but will have no play on the return. I learned by playing the Synchro event that in these cases it is always better to keep a possible target of the VW effects in the safest way possible so as not to fall into situations like drawing a name and not being able to activate it.   Psy-Framegear Gamma is Level 2 so you can only bring it onto the field with Emergence Teleport if you haven't resolved any Virtual World effects from your hand this turn. Interactions of Infinite Impermanence and a monster in the GY like Kyubi - Shenshen activating effect to return to the field are quite interesting because you can use Infinite Impermanence as Chain Link 2 to Shenshen's effect to negate an opponent's monster while you control no cards on the field. //////////////////////////////////////////////// //Disregard the Side Deck, these are just examples of cards that can also be used in the deck. And about the Extra Deck I also talk about the main cards needed since this Extra Deck doesn't need all these cards to play Virtual World. - The first three cards close the Synchro monsters that I consider useful to use in the Virtual World for the Synchro format and the Mist Wurm would be an SR version of the Trishula, Dragon of the Ice Barrier since its summon condition is the same, the XX-Saber Gottoms is used in a more fun version of the deck focused on Looping it back onto the field with Cloudcastel so that it uses its non-Hard Once Per Turn effect of Tributing itself and discarding a random card from the opponent's hand and to do this Loop is used a monster called Beast of the Pharaoh that simply returns to the field whenever used as Synchro Material allowing you to continue making Cloudcastel and discarding up to 4 cards from your opponent's hand, the only problem with this combo is that you have to Hard Draw of the Beast of the Pharaoh to be your Normal Summon. Scarlight Red Dragon Archfiend is yet another Level 8 Dragon-type Synchro option to bring to the field with Ultimaya Tzolkin when you set a Spell/Trap on the field. But my real Extra Deck that I used to finish the Synchro Festival did not have all these options that I present to you, it was the following: 2 Stardust Charge Warrior, 1 Coral Dragon, 1 Adamancipator Risen - Raptite, 1 Virtual World Beast - Jiujiu, 2 Cloudcastel, 1 Vermillion Dragon Mech, 1 Ravenous Crocodragon Archethys, 1 Virtual World Kyubi - Shenshen and 1 Geomathmech Final Sigma. And between these cards Raptite and Geomathmech Final Sigma I'm only using it because I already had it on my account and you can get Crocodragon by opening Legacy Pack. So I built this deck at the end spending 2 UR which were Shenshen and Jiujiu and the rest were the Virtual World main deck SR cards and the extra Deck Level 6 and Level 9 SR monsters so you don't need to craft Ultimaya Tzolkin and Crystal Wing to play Virtual World at this event. - Some tech card choices for consistency: Foolish Burial Goods and Metalfoes Fusion have the versatility that it doesn't even matter if you draw Metalfoes Fusion because you discard it by the effects of Qinglong and Xuanwu to use the effect to go back to the Deck and give 1 Draw, on the other hand, Celestial Observatory is interesting in the deck given the high number of Level 6 monsters we use. Pot of Prosperity is the second best Pot to use in Virtual World but it doesn't even come close to Pot of Desires and finally Upstart Goblin which needs no introduction of how good a consistency card it is. - Genex Ally Birdman, Psychic Tracker and Psychic Wheeleder are Level 3 Extenders options to use in the deck allowing you to make plays like Trishula, Dragon of the Ice Barrier and give you even more targeting options to bring into the field with Emergence Teleport. Destrudo the Lost Dragon's Frisson is an Extender option to access Baronne de Fleur in the Virtual World deck because you target any Level 3 monster you control and for half its LP cost it enters the field as a Level 4 monster Tuner allowing to make Baronne de Fleur together with a Level 6 monster. - Finally, we have floodgates like There Can Be Only One and Skill Drain that can be used on the deck without affecting the gameplay too much, but you should train a lot especially with There Can Be Only One before you start using it because it has a certain restriction on the way to do your Combo while it's activated. The funny thing about using Floodgates in this deck is that you can turn them off whenever you want with the Virtual World Gate - Chuche that can destroy your own cards.

el Deck presenta un enfoque mayor en la sincronía (las Yuki-Onna están fuera) por lo que me enfoqué en mas el uso de sus sincronías y la alimentación del cementerio para hacer cadenas de invocación especial de este mismo. La estrategia es la misma que en cualquier deck Mayakashi, invocar por sincronía escaladamente y luego disminuir en el orden en que fueron invocados. The Deck features a greater focus on Synchro (Yuki-Onna are out) so I focused more on using their Synchro and Graveyard feed to make Special Summon Chains of it. The strategy is the same as in any Mayakashi deck, Synchro Summon escalation and then decrease in the order they were Summoned.

deck_excerpt: Fun Local build for testing the new Albaz Structure Deck
deck_description: Basically the concept of this build is to test the synergy with Tri-brigades and the new Albaz Structure deck. The Build seems to provide good disruptions against meta decks but still lacks the grind game. If your opponent lets you play with minimal disruptions the end boards can be tough to out with the constant recycling of the Branded card and Fusion monsters, and the link climb to Shuraig. Overall fun strategy for locals .

deck_description: Final Countdown

Draw power based, spellcaster centric deck that i have fun just tooling around with minor changes- if you can survive till turn 3-4 should have an easy otk through schism/silent magician/quintet/prophecy--- all endboards are relatively similar due to how easy you run through the deck.

deck_excerpt: Big fun, big combo Karakuri deck for Master Duel
deck_description: This deck is real fun. Usually ends in 2 quick effect banishes and 1 Omni negate. Your goal is to make aurodon at any cost, then ladder into your shoguns and barrone. It dies to one handtrap but there are ways to mitigate that like crossout.  Card by card time  Main Deck:  Anchor Drill - This deck really needs to open at least one extender to get to halq. This plus any Karakuri tuner, which you run 10 of, is full combo.  Heavy Forward - One more heavy forward and it can bait out ash if your opponent is bad.  Ready and Instant fusion - These are free, non normal summon tuner and earth machine extenders. Gamma oil - You also want to draw this. Later on in the combo it can make big plays and it can set up the combo earlier on.  Ninishi - This card is great whether you draw it or not. This plus any Karakuri is full combo (This includes gamma oil). You can also grab it from your deck to get an extra normal summon. That’s a search with merchant, that gets kumanzan, that gets you an end board with another one or two negates. If you just have a tuner, its still another negate.  Merchant - As stated in Ninishi, this card is a great extra extender. If this is the only usable card you draw, you can end with one draw and a bureibu.  Gama - this card makes bureibu a good interruption and is great for ladder. Also it is a Karakuri tuner  Barrel - This is a Karakuri tuner and its level is useful for laddering.  Bonze - this card is great to summon after you summon barrone. It lets you get two bureibus and a super shogun in addition to the barrone.  Watchdog - this is a level four tuner which can make a shogun with a mecha phantom beast token. Not the best to draw, but it’s only a half brick since its a Karakuri tuner.  Maxx C - You need to play this card. It’s a win button going first or second.  Ash - This card stops maxx c.  Crossout - This stops maxx c, Nibiru, called by the grave, and ash, all of which end your turn.  Called by the Grave - This stops most handtraps.  Nibiru - you play this card because of crossout but it is fine going second.  001 - This is a garnet. Necessary for aurodon combo  Extra Deck:  Burei - This card is exclusively here for laddering into your end board cards, but it is very good at laddering.  Steel Shogun - Great for laddering and okay on an end board.  Super Shogun - Banishing your opponents cards are good. With gama you, it’s a quick effect. Usually you end with 2.  Barrone - This is the card you usually end on with your two Super shoguns. Omni negates are good.  Borreload Savage - This a backup barrone. Still very good. You don’t need both.  Sea Monster of Theses and Cyber Saurus - Cyber saurus isn’t that necessary. It shows up on edge scenarios. You can replace sea monster with the peacock guy if your strapped for sr tokens.  Aurodon - Deck revolves around this card  Needlefiber - Needed for aurodon combo.  Almiraj - can help you make Needlefiber if you only open a tuner and gama oil.

deck_excerpt: This is an Evil Twin deck that is meant to use your links to absolutely destroy all of what your opponent is doing. This is the version is what I an w
deck_description: Stategy: Make sure your opponent cannot even play the game. Going first is always best, but you are not too limited by going second. The main movement is using the Evil Twin Links to draw and destroy opponents cards. This deck has a super strong first turn, but still has a solid second turn because of the handtraps. I will keep updating this deck as soon as I find better strategies.

deck_description: You can summon monsters and then banish them after. You can use this deck to quickly summon very strong monsters and get away with putting those cards used to get it back in the deck.

deck_excerpt: No Special Summoning from the GY for you!
deck_description:
Gravekeepers got an AMAZING support card in the form of the creatively named Gravekeeper's Trap which allows them to discard 1 monster to search a Gravekeeper monster. Their only combo is getting Gravekeeper's Spiritualist in the GY and looping her back with Gravekeeper's Headman 's effect to bring out Gravekeeper's Supernaturalist and Quintet Magician. Gravekeeper's Visionary will benefit from a card like Exchange of the Spirit + their new trap. Relinquished Anima and Artemis, the Magistus Moon Maiden are in the Ed to get Magicians' Souls and any lvl 4 or lower Gkeeper respectively to the GY. Hidden Temples of Necrovalley and Necrovalley itself should be able to win/stall games on their own.

Please Konami give them another fusion and a card that special summons itself, Headman's loop is not funny please.

Note: Gravekeeper's Trap isnt in the deckbuilder yet.

deck_name: Galaxy-Eyes 2nd Turn OTK - Platinum Level (Master Duel)
deck_excerpt: OTK with Number 62: Galaxy-Eyes Prime Photon Dragon, for Master Duel
deck_description: The goal of this deck is to make Number 62: Galaxy-Eyes Prime Photon Dragon with Photon Dragon and Afterglow as the 2 materials. Battle Phase use Prime's effect to make it 5600, detach Afterglow for 11200 ATK or more. Your hand should hold all the tools you need to get both dragons onto the field and then some, with all the draws, searches, and special summons.  This deck can also go into a normal strategy if there isn't an opportunity to hit, or if both of your Prime Dragons have died.  I recommend swapping out 2 Accellight and the Photon Vanisher for any of the staples you need, if you need them.
